Reviews.Title: “Great service and great beds”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunny91
Reviews.Content: Generally love the Starwood products and usually W's. Definitely a young vibe so may not be the most ideal for families though our kids were with us. They loved the hotel and room. Had a great view and though they only had a king for us four they brought up feather beds with ample bedding so the kids were happy. Restaurant was OK.

Reviews.Title: “good location with small, trendy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Rooms are average to small with some very oddly designed lighting (note to push the on button on the side near the base, but not on the base). As characteristic with some of the other W hotels (Times Square, for example), the lobby is on an upper floor, so that helps getting and out of the hotel (not having to worry about the traffic on the ground level). Note that the hotel is directly facing the Ground Zero construction and visitor sites, so it can be a little messy, crowded and noisy. That said, the hotel is nice and clean with good amenities. I wouldn't recommend the hotel for families, but then that isn't traditionally the market for the W hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Painfully Hip - Noisy - Expected A Little More”
Reviews.Author: Reason88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in this hotel for a wedding one night that was close by. We booked on Hotwire and got a fair rate. This was my first stay at the W. This hotel is located right next to Ground Zero and the new WTC 9/11 Memorial, there are a lot of tourists at ground level and it can get a little hectic. That said, you are in one of the best areas of downtown. Check-in was fast, we had a nice room with modern decor. There were some parts, like the bathroom that I thought were really odd, but overall nice. We had a great view of the memorial from the 9th Floor and could see the new Memorial Waterfalls which I think was awesome. On the rest of the hotel. The elevators and other areas of the hotel are jazzed out with style, it was all a little overwhelming. The food at the bar was average but ok (nice tap list) and the bar at night has a DJ and is a place to be seen. Expensive but innovative cocktails. So why isn't the hotel more than average? Noise. The hotel is loud and in a loud area, you won't get much sleep, in spite of the very comfortable bed. For the price we paid, you expect a good night's sleep. I just think that goes without saying. We had a heating/air vent that zoomed on at 3 AM and woke us both up, never did get back to bed. Overall, if you are a light sleeper and can get a deal, this is a great option, for me the noise didn't ruin the hotel, but took it down from something I can truly recommend to one that I recommend caution with.

Reviews.Title: “Unfreindly for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: tiffanychong21
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 4 nights for business and this is first time in this area, the service on 1st floor bar and grill was horrible, me and my customer were sitting at the bar area for 15 minutes and no one ask if we want to order, we finally wave to the bar staff and witness the dispute between the waitrer and bar tender that no one wants to work in that area, they finally took our order but like doing us a favor. Internet was terrible, phone reception in the room was horrible, and then the life music at the lobby area was so loud that if you stay from 9th floor and below, your can't escape music even you in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best W and not the Worst”
Reviews.Author: ktattai
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Years 2012. No major complaints. Was upgraded to a suite. The room was spacious with modern decore. Only downside was that I had to have housekeeping re-clean the room upon arrival.There were M&M mashed on the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: RileyA123
Reviews.Content: Rates on SPG site per NBR code state 159, however, nowhere is this rate available. After spending over 50 minutes on the phone and speaking to 3 different people, I was told this was a mistake on their website as they couldn't find this available rate anywhere either! Would not honor the rate because they couldn't reach the hotel front desk directly!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel- great staff”
Reviews.Author: karistiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some girl friends as a mini reunion. We all went to school downtown- we love and are familiar with the area. The hotel is easy to get to- lots of subways within a few blocks. The room was really clean. Everything was sleek and modern. If you don't want to be naked in front of who you are traveling with, let the shower steam up first. We had a room where the glass shower wall was the only wall for the bathroom...even though it's not clear glass, you see everything! Hotel staff was really nice and helpful. Toiletries are Bliss brand and I loooooved them. There is still a lot of construction going on in WTC- hearing that noise in the morning was obnoxious. The bed was soooo comfortable. I slept like a baby until a jackhammer woke me up. Bar had good drinks- kind of expensive. Overall, If you're into the modern look, this place is probably for you. Im not...but I didn't dislike it- I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, its a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angie W
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great location. Loads to see downtown but at night things are a bit quieter, you are not barging past crowds to get from A-Z like you are around Times Square. I stayed for 3 nights in a twin, double room. Best bits, the beds are sooooo comfy to sleep in, crisp, white linen, super soft pillows and lots of them. The room was a really good size, the best size I've experienced in a NY hotel ; so rare. The shower was amazing, powerful and easy to operate/find the right temperature. Bathroom came with decent toiletries inc bath robe and a powerful hair dryer (ladies you can leave yours behind at home)! The room had all the mod cons: plasma TV mounted on the wall, DAB radio come iPod dock, air con, in room mini bar. There was ample storage and wardrobe space for a short stay. The view from the bedroom window was fab, you walk in and are instantly drawn to the big windows, lots of light floods in. I had an amazing view of the financial district's skyscrapers and the Ground Zero memorial site. Seeing it from 17 floors up was very impressive. So what else about this hotel? It is über trendy in its design, you could be forgiven for thinking you'd walked in to an upmarket bar rather than a hotel. It is clealry trying to appeal to the hip young, clubbing, crowd. Just to the side of reception you’ll see some DJ decks for the evenings ambience. Despite this, I never heard the music or the crowd from my room. The scene may or may not be your thing but it's not intimidating. I don’t consider myself trendy nor does my old man, who travelled with me, but he was fine with it all, if not slightly bemused. All staff I met were friendly and more than happy to help. Check in was quick and easy, within moments I had key card in hand and was catching the lift to my room. The hotel was quiet, no noisy neighbours, my room was directly opposite the lift and I didn't hear a peep. The hotel includes a couple of bars/restaurants - the one bar has a balcony on three sides which might be nice on a warm evening. There is also a gym - I didn't get chance to explore these options but its there if you need it. Every morning they put out free coffee and tea which you can help yourself to - nice little touch before you head out for a day of fun in the city. For me this particular visit was about comfort. Knowing I wouldn't be in my room much but would be totally exhausted when I was, I wanted comfort and quiet so I could get a good kip in. The comfort of the bed, the space to move around the room easily without tripping over suitcases and each other is why this hotel worked for me. As for rate, well I believe I had a steal. Booked last minute-ish via Expedia and paid £350 for 3 nights for two adults, sharing a twin, room only. The acid test...would I return...Yes, Yes and Yes. I can't wait until I have another reason to return to new York/W Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5th SPG property in the City”
Reviews.Author: imari96
Reviews.Content: I stayed downtown this trip as a result of having a meeting in the area. A word about the area - it is uneventful really. Another reviewed called it "soulless" and while I wouldn't go that far, I would say that there are better neighborhoods to stay in. For the hotel, I think this hotel was nicely done. I have an issue with the lobby check in simply because it's small and if there are a lot of people trying to check, it could be crowded. I really enjoyed the decor (even if modern / trendy isn't my personal taste). My room was clean and comfortable. Like many other W's, there was alot of snacks and other items taking up space on the desk. Speaking of the desk, it was slightly small for my business needs. I'm sure a larger room wouldn't have this issue. I absolutely loved the window seat they had. I sat there while preparing for a meeting instead of the desk. Bed was of course, very comfortable. I agree with another reviewer who said it would have been nice to have towel hooks. The counter space was also small. Shower was great though. I used the gym once and preferred the gym at The Westin, mainly for the equipment and space. However, the gym was still good and really my only complaint is having to walk through the lobby to get to the second set of elevators to use the gym. I found the staff to be very friendly here too - not annoying friendly but just enough. BLT restaurant was cute and I really enjoyed my lunch. If I don't stay here again, it would only be because of the location. Otherwise, a great option!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Birthday Experience At The W Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Yaniv M
Reviews.Content: From the time I called, to the time I left, it was an extremely pleasant experience. We called up in advance to tell them it was my birthday. The next thing I knew, they were asking me what my favorite snacks were and top favorite songs. As soon as we arrived at the hotel, I was mesmerized by the modern architecture and gorgeous decor. The staff were very friendly and helpful and checked us in a jiffy. When we went upstairs to our room, we were greeted with my favorite songs playing in the backround off of the flatscreen T.V., and my favorite snacks sitting on the desk. The beds were very comfortable and we slept like babies through the night. The next day, after we enjoyed a restfull night and enjoyed ourselves in NYC, we came back in the evening to find that the beds were turned down and were left W brand water bottles. We were also informed of the W Acura Experience, which enables you to have a free ride there and back to any destination city wide by appontment. Overall, I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who is visiting the big apple. Although this hotel is currently rated 4 1/2 stars, I would definately give it 5 stars. We had no issues whatsoever and would definately stay here again the next time we are in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Toni S
Reviews.Content: I loved our stay at the hotel. Im a nanny and travelled with the family for business. I was responsible for booking the hotel where we stayed which was stressful. However, the W exceeded all of my boss' expectations. She said that she will only stay here from now on. Every staff member we ran into was beyond friendly and helpful. There was one staff member that stood out during our stay... Nadar the complimentary Acura driver we were assigned to take us into uptown. The service only provides a drop off so I was nervous about getting back to our hotel. I told Nadar this and he gave me his phone number and told me to call when we were ready and he would come pick us up. I can't even explain what a relief this was since I was alone, 6 months pregnant and had a 1 year old with me. He was kind, friendly and a real life saver. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tragically Hip!”
Reviews.Author: ECB2010
Reviews.Content: W hotels have a brand all their own. They are stylish, modern and very hip. If this is what you are searching for then you will not be disappointed. In addition the room was surprisingly large for a boutique hotel in New York. The sleeping area was superb and the bathroom was a real luxury. The staff were all very courteous and attentive. That being said there are one or two drawbacks. First of all I a, not a fan of the financial district. It is a soulless part of an otherwise vibrant city. In future I would opt for a hotel in Soho, the Village, or possibly closer to Union Square. Second of all, I personally feel that the W chain takes itself too seriously and often feel that the modernity comes at a cost of some basic practicalities and creature comforts. The room was marvelous but the bathroom lacked some basic fixtures for hanging up wet towels for example. The darkness in the lobby and bar areas seem cool at first but when black greets you in every room even at 9am it becomes a little tired very quickly. The most irritating aspect of the stay was the so-called complimentary Accura car service. Upon check-in you are told that there's is one free complimentary drop off in the city with the hotel's Accura fleet for each day of your stay. We tried to book this on three separate occasions without success. We also witnessed other guests being told that the service was unavailable. One of the basics rules of hospitality is under promise and over deliver. By turning this old adage on its head the hotel left numerous guests feeling disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: DDBSB
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviews of the W New York - Downtown: it's a great hotel, very clean, with an amazing view of Ground Zero and the 9/11 Memorial. On the positive side, rooms have a nice decor, mini-bar is well stocked and everything seems to be well kept. Definitely a 4-star experience. On the negative side, the lobby mobile DJ/club "thing" is indeed a bit annoying, especially if you have to make your way through the crown to the elevator with luggage. Additionally, I was just a few floors above the lobby level and was able to hear the sound coming from the dance floor. I didn't really care about it, but it might be a good idea to ask for a room in a higher floor so to avoid trouble. Overall a good experience, would definitely do again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob04
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were in town to celebrate his birthday, take in the WTC Memorial and see a broadway show. The W Hotel was a wonderful place to stay. Rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. I have only two minor complaints....1) You have to take two sets of elevators to get to your room. Once you get off the first elevator you have to walk through the night club to get to the second set of elevators. They are renovating so I am not sure if this will change. 2) My husband and I wanted to grab a drink at BLT after a show. We walked in the bar at 11:00pm on a Saturday night and the bartender informed us that they had already called last call. At 11:00 on a Saturday night???? All in all those were very MINOR complaints. Also, take advantage of the Acura Free Ride offered to guests. It was such a pleasant experience after spending the day using public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure how it is for business but fun on a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: ChrisS_DC
Reviews.Content: Came up to NY to visit with friends. Be aware that the W is not so quiet on the weekends, when I came in at 1 AM on Sat night the party was still going. I had never been in the Wall St. area so the W downtown's location made it easy to take part of a morning to wander around and take in a few sites and is located immedaitely across the Street from the World Trade Center memorial. The W was very relaxed during the day Sunday and my room had a super comfortable bed. I was in a corner room which had good space and a unique padded seating area under the windows. I was not up high and also didn't have a view of the WTC Memorial from my room but the view from the 5th floor lobby was exceptional. Service met my expectations and the staff was quite responsive to all of my requests. Room service always showed up at my door ahead of the promised 15-20 minutes and food was delicious. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “everything I've come to love about the W....”
Reviews.Author: travellingfamily7M
Reviews.Content: ....I found in this hotel. Our room was located directly next to the elevator. I panicked at first, but it was super quiet and we never heard a sound! It was clean and comfortable with a beautiful view of the harbor. The surrounding neighborhood is quiet at night, but it was perfect for us. We were still able to be out late at night, enjoy wonderful pizza right around the corner, and had easy access to public transportation. We arrived home just today, and I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Too much trendiness”
Reviews.Author: trripman
Reviews.Content: I like hip, up to a point. But at some point it starts to feel as though this hotel is trying too hard. The entrance is under construction now and it's a bit awkward finding your way in but you need to get an elevator to the 5th floor. In the spirit of hipness, it's dark at the check-in desk-very dark. So dark that when you go to the elevators, you can't see the buttons to press. It's very loud on that floor.Very,very loud. Did I mention that it was loud? You ascend to your floor and then struggle with the hip touch-card door key, trying not to feel silly, and eventually figure it out. But even in your room you can still hear the techno from the lower floors. Not too bad, but, you know, it's techno. Hard to ignore as a background thump. Room is fine -pretty standard. Not the hotels fault but LOTS of construction noise from World Trade Center construction which starts pretty early in the am. Service too is a little bit...lacking. No newspaper delivery as promised. No restocking of the mini-bar, No restocking even when called. Room does not appear to be nicely tidied in the day. All in all, an overage of the average. This place is I think a little over-hipped and maybe over-hyped. Think of it as a dark (and noisy) Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Higbie
Reviews.Content: I love the beds at the W… every W I have ever stayed at. Always a huge plus. The food was really good at the bar, really enjoyed the ambivalence as well. Hip cool vibe you would expect at the W. I am not much of a hipster, but wasn’t bothered at all by the music or the crowd, it is exactly what you would expect at a W. They do cater to the young and hip, if your not comfortable with this, you should look elsewhere. I also do not mind the downtown location but it isn’t for everyone – if you are looking for a quick weekend and want to be in the middle of everything, you may want to consider other neighborhoods. The service was OK, not great – we waited a while at check in and to get settled. When we got to our room, our key didn’t work so we had to go back to the desk – the whole thing just took way to long. The biggest disappointment was the cleanliness of the room – huge turnoff, and the main reason for the poor rating. The walls were scuffed up, just looked very dirty. There were hangers in the closet from another hotel. I wouldn’t stay again just for the cleanliness factor – it wasn’t dirty enough to make me check out, but dirty enough to make me uncomfortable and not want to hang out in the room. Not what I would expect from the W or at that price point. One note - we stayed here on a weekend, so it was pretty slow. It was also prior to the 9/11 Memorial opening, so it may be busier now.

Reviews.Title: “Too hip for their own good.”
Reviews.Author: Celticsguy
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here unless your looking to check into a night club instead of a hotel. This property tries to be chic by literally turning their lobby into a nightclub with DJ at night. So you end up yelling so you can be heard as you check in. You have to navigate past the DJ booth just to get you and your family to the elevator. The music resonated all the way into our 7th floor room until 2am and then we got to listen to the patrons stumble to their rooms for another hour. Overall the rooms and staff are truly 4 star, but need to remind themselves that hotels are not destinations but rather places to get rested and refreshed. There are plenty of nightclubs in New York, putting a mobile one in your lobby makes no sense.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster Hell”
Reviews.Author: dagst47
Reviews.Content: Good: clean, decent place to stay. Bad: title says it all. This place is crawling with sock-headed hipsters. The Carlyle is less pretentious and a lot less annoying. I know that The W is targeting a certain type of visitor, but they really missed the mark on this one. Let's start with arrival- You enter on the fifth floor, where the front desk is located. Attached to the lobby is the lobby bar (ok, so far sounds normal, right?) but then they decided to fill the empty space with... A DJ setup. You then have to walk across an empty dance floor with the DJ on your right and bar patrons on your left, disco ball overhead, just to get to the elevator that goes to your room. When you are travel weary and carrying luggage, believe me this is not a relaxing welcome. The following morning we woke up to No Coffee in our room. A small sign indicates that there is complimentary coffee on the fifth floor. Great, I'll go grab some cups and dance my way to some java. I'm redirected to the second floor. 8 bucks plus tip later, I have my coffee. Apparently, the coffee is only complimentary on the fifth floor between 6-10am. That's just lame. Oh, I can request that a coffee maker is brought to my room. Too little too late. Coffee and disco atmosphere aside, it's a clean hotel and a decent place to stay. Grow out some ironic facial hair and get ready to boogie your way to your room each night- you'll fit right in.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: beeno0412
Reviews.Content: The W Downtown is a perfect location for anything in the FiDi. Right across the Freedom Tower and close enough to Battery Park if you're planning on checking out the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. Standard rooms are small (it is NYC after all) but well appointed, bright and modern. I of course love the Bliss amenities! The desk staff were welcoming and friendly. I would love to visit again in warmer weather as it looks like the lobby bar opens up to a terrace. Would be great on a beautiful summer night! For breakfast in the morning, we went right around the corner to George's Diner rather than eating at the hotel and were not disappointed. Overall a great stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, ok location”
Reviews.Author: cestchr
Reviews.Content: Booked this on Hotwire, so we didn't know what we were getting until we paid. Very modern, clean. Very comfortable beds. Our room overlooked the 9/11 Memorial, which was pretty cool.However, getting to and from the hotel was a bit of a pain. Tough to get a cab and then when we did we were stuck in downtown traffic. It's out of the way. Staff was friendly at the desk. If location was different I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “W Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy A
Reviews.Content: Pros: it was located right next to ground zero in the heart of the financial district. the concierge was very helpful with tons of recommendations, the W beds are always comfortable, the gym had all the usual gym equipments including a boxing bag and headphones if you forgot yours. Cons: the showers are a bit see through if you are traveling with friends, there are some chips and marks on the wall so it needs a little bit of a touch up, lots of one way streets so be careful if you are driving down, its a great location if you are there fore business, a long cab ride away if you like to spend your time partying in soho, meatpacking, or tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Becoming my hotel of choice in Lower Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A98101
Reviews.Content: Completed my second stay at the W, and surprised by the relatively low ratings. The hotel and its staff are top notch. Friendly, customer oriented (when I was a few minutes late to get the last of the free coffee at breakfast, even though it was put away, the staff poured the last bits out of the coffee maker for me!) and helpful. Rooms are big (for New York) and views are lovely -- even over Ground Zero, as somber as it might be. It is true the neighborhood is still developing and it is not easy to get a cab in front of the hotel, but that's true of all the hotels in Lower Manhattan. For someone who knows their way around a bit, it's a great location -- near trains and buses, a Whole Foods Market, coffee shops, stores, Shake Shack. Good enough for me. Would be nice if the restaurant served a full menu later -- there aren't a lot of late night choices in the immediate few blocks. Looking forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: kahmedsid
Reviews.Content: If you literally want to stay next to ground zero (and the financial district) and that too in the most modern and chic places, this is where you want to be. The lobby area transforms into a lounge at night (or at least on Saturday nights). The only thing I did not like was that the lobby is on the 5th floor so you take elevator 1 to get there and then elevator 2 to go to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Surprise”
Reviews.Author: sunnyincali835
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that this was the highlight of our trip to New York City. My wife and I were traveling in from The Netherlands and this was the last leg of our anniversary trip. New York City was the surprise for my wife, and she was truly amazed by the service and good nature of the staff at your hotel. There are a few people at the hotel who really made the experience magical. Robert at the door is truly incredible. He always greeted us with a smile, and he was always helpful with pointing us in the right direction on how to get around in the area. The Acura driver, I believe his name was Nader? was a true pleasure to be around. He showed us some amazing sites while we drove to our destination, and he even played the music station that we liked on the radio. Please tell him that we did try the pizza that he recommended, and it was incredible. Finally, the front desk staff at this hotel is truly top notch. Please forgive me if I mispell their names, but Jevon and Yahayra are truly a fun duo to be around. You can really tell that they enjoy working together and they are EXTREMELY funny. It was fun to share stories with Jevon about The Netherlands, and we even liked the same beer from there lol. Both Jevon and Yahayra always greeted us with a smile and were always able to answer any questions that we had for them. They even upgraded us to a suite since it was our anniversary and gave us free drinks at the bar. The view of the site was truly breath taking, and it really gave us a chance to take in the history that we were experiencing. It is because of them, that my wife will never forget this trip that we had. The room was excellent and it smelled amazing. I am still trying to figure out what it is that they spray the rooms with, as I want to get that for my own house. The drinks at the bar are strong, which is a plus, and the hotel is conveniently located next to all the major subway lines in the city so getting around was not a problem for us. Please make sure that everyone gets word of how much we enjoyed their service and accommodating attitude. We have told all of our friends about this wonderful hotel, and we will be back soon to enjoy it again.

Reviews.Title: “the beds are amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: ideadensity
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. Everything was great. The hotel was clean, attractive, and modern. The staff was helpful and polite. On check in the staff helped us by printing our tickets for the show we were going to see that night, The hotel is in a nice location and there are taxis available and there are multiple subway lines available within very close walking distance. We took the subway up a couple of stattions to check out Little Italy and Chinatown. My favorite part was the bed. The linens felt really nice, they seemed to be really high quality and the matress was amazingly comfortable. It was a dream! There was a plush down comforter and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Funky with a view”
Reviews.Author: Bruce Q
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to Wall St for business meetings I had to attend, and also great view from the hotel overlooking the 9/11 memorial. Funky designs in the hotel lobby, cool stylized furnitures in the room. The rooms are slightly smaller than most standard ones, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The W New York - Downtown staff keeps me coming back.”
Reviews.Author: Trav3lm0re
Reviews.Content: This hotel shines because of its staff. This week, I spent two night at the W and met two front desk attendants, two concierges, a bartender and 4 bellmen. To a person, they were friendly and helpful -- I felt that that all really enjoyed their jobs. My concierge, Kareem, was a super helpful. He helped me plan 3 business meals -- a breakfast, a lunch and a dinner and arranged the Acura car service and got me a ticket to the 9-11 memorial across the street. His restaurant selections were spot on and he couldn't have been any faster in helping me. That kind of service is what more W's should strive for and this one achieves on a regular basis. While this property has some challenges -- there is huge and noisy construction project across the street and for the first time, I heard the elevator with noisy guests late in the evening -- the warm and helpful staff makes up for that. I should also mention Nadir and the Acura car service. Though availability is limited, do take advantage of this service. Nadir drove me all the way to the Metropolitan Museum of Art at no charge. When I mentioned I had skipped breakfast that day, he made several suggestions of restaurants nearby -- I opted for a neighborhood bagel place he recommended. It was perfect. What a friendly guy who really loves New York... and sadly, the New England Patriots. (But that's another story!) Again, a great staff experience. I wouldn't hesitate to return on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “W STANDS FOR WOW”
Reviews.Author: NoHoBoy
Reviews.Content: The moment i step foot in it's unassuming lobby, I knew I will like it. The smell of elevator was like fresh linens. The lobby was uber chic and cool. The views were magnificent. The best part about it -- It's not too crowded like the other hotels in city. The staff were friendly and warm. My room was on the 22nd floor facing the 9/11 Memorial which was very melancholic yet empowering. I love my room. It was modern and sophisticated. The noise from the construction site didn't really affected my sleep so it wasn't really a big deal. The subway stations were less than 3 blocks away which was perfect and easy to navigate. I'm definitely recommending this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: zeemers101
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a W Hotel and it was a good but not great experience. The first impression was fantastic - friendly and cheerful staff, a funky interior design and I was impressed with how they paid attention to the small details (ex. the carpets in the elevator say "Good Morning / Afternoon / Evening" depending on the time of day). All this goodwill started to slip away once I had a better sense of their customer service. The concierge was terrible at fulfilling simple requests (ex. on two occasions, I asked for a bowl to be sent up to the room in the morning only to realize that it was never going to come) and miscommunication by the staff was not handled professionally at all (ex. I was told that I could have the front desk print a document for me and that I should bring it down on a flash drive, but upon arriving at the front desk, the rude clerk told me they can't extract information from flash drives at the front desk and that I needed to email it to her. This was after she spoke to her colleague about me in a condescending manner...while I was standing in front of her). It's hit or miss with the staff - some of them are fantastic while others definitely need to be replaced. Also - be wary of rooms facing the 9/11 memorial. There is tons of construction taking place so there's noise throughout the day (including early mornings and late evenings). Thankfully it didn't affect me much (I'm a deep sleeper) but might be irritating to others.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Pennylee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 3 days in december 2011. The hotel was clean, no bedbugs, rooms are average size for NYC, bathroom was clean and modern. If you plan on visiting the Ground Zero memorial, the hotel is perfectly located, just accross the street from the fountains. Didn't hear any noise whatsoever, I found the room to be well insonorized, althought it was just besides the elevators and electrical room (I think they gave us the worst possible room location ever, even if the hotel was half empty - perhaps because we had a special rate). The view was insignificant, in the back of the hotel. The location of the hotel is great for visiting downtown/Financial District and very close to the subway station. It is up to par with the W standards. Expect a cold reception, a cold atmosphere. Cleanliness and design are the keywords here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Jackhammer”
Reviews.Author: TPSer
Reviews.Content: Be warned that there is still heavy construction being done on ground zero, and one side of the hotel is subject to very loud construction noise including a jackhammer. Construction does not stop until 11:00 p.m., and starts back up again at 6:00 a.m. The hotel did move me to the other side for the second night of my stay which was much better. The room was about half the size, but it was a fair trade off for the noise which was unbearable. This hotel also charges internet access in the room, which is a pet peeve of mine. Two machines in the work-out room were not functional. I was less than impressed with BLT - tuna tartare was good, but I think I got yesterday's lobster on my risotto and did not eat about half of it. I survived, however. Bar staff very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff!”
Reviews.Author: OCGAL11
Reviews.Content: We were moving my son to New York to start his new job. My wife surprised us and booked a room at the W, around the corner from his apartment. We have stayed at "W" hotels in the past so I was expecting great service! This location was exceptional! The rooms were very comfortable, yes, they are small, but this is New York! There were three employees that were phenomenal! Dominique, Christine & Kristine. They went above and beyond to accommodate us! We will definitely be back here again soon! Thank you "W" hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “I liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hazel C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the first week in December and loved it. Although I must agree that the hotel room was small, it was more than sufficient in meeting our needs. It was most definately the most funkiest hotel we've ever stayed in too!! We found the staff to be extremely helpful, especially the concierge. The could not do enough to help us with our sight-seeing expeditions. It it a little way out of town, so the only way to get around is by the subway or cab, but it is a 5-10min walk to the ferry to take you to see the Statue of Liberty, and also we had a grand view of WTC. My overall opinion is very positive, but I would prefer to stay a little more mid-town next time we visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “Complete WASTE of time & Money!”
Reviews.Author: Anu K
Reviews.Content: Please do not book this hotel for your stay in NYC! The location is a nightmare if you are driving. It's surrounded by ground zero which kind-a creeped me out. The moment we entered in this hotel it gave me negative wibe. The staff was friendly and helpful but the hotel was not at all what I expected it to be. The room was tiny and the bed was uncomfortable. The bathroom was clean but very small and the toiletteries provided were disgusting! We actually cit our trip short here and moved to a hotel at Times' sqaure to get some peace of mind and feel happy about our stay in NYC. I will NEVER go back to this hotel and to this specific location.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: samantha b
Reviews.Content: I love everything the location is walking distance to a ferry going to Liberty Island. All the front desk staff are nice.. Its a cool place... The design of the rooms is so nice evrything is nice! nice! nice!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and fun”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a W (at least in NY - I've stayed here and the one on Lexington), you should know you're going to get a small room. They're pretty tiny from my experiance, just a bed and a washroom - that said, there's enough room and that's really all you need. Just don't try packing more than two people in there and don't bring 3 suitcases. The service here is great, the hotel (like all their hotels) are big on style, and there are also a lot of fun little details built into it. For a reasonable price you get a boutique experiance and a great location... with the constuction it could be noisy, but nothing overly intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: MJL395
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I stayed here one night a couple weeks back and its nice to stay at a new hotel here in NYC. Just a word for the wise, the rooms will be be quiet anytime soon with the constant construction work at the WTC. The upside to this is getting a great view of the Freedom Tower and the surrounding area of downtown Manhattan. I stayed on a Friday night and the bar/lounge had a DJ there.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Weekend”
Reviews.Author: tgctravels
Reviews.Content: My family decided to take my Dad to the city to surprise him for hist birthday and we stayed at the W Downtown. A nice, secure hotel right next to the 9/11 memorial. We had connecting king and double rooms that were spacious and clean. The beds were quite comfortable and size of the bathroom was very reasonable. Service was quick and efficient while still personalized and we had no problems during our stay. The view of the memorial from our room was fantastic. The only downside to this property is that it can be really difficult to get a cab at night and the few choices for dinner, drinks, etc. in the evening. It is the Financial District however so if you're looking for action, try another part of town. Complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby (living room) each morning and an interesting bar scene at night. A key card is required to use the elevator which adds an element of safety, at the same time, can be a nuisance. Very friendly staff overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and decor”
Reviews.Author: Stepha10
Reviews.Content: What a view!! We stayed here 2 nights in November 2011. The location is great. The room was luxurious and we had an amazing view onto 9/11 Memorial. The service was very friendly. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “No "wow" factor...”
Reviews.Author: backinnewyork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend on 12/3/11 and stayed in room 1009. It was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen in NYC. There was about 2 feet on each side of the King size bed. The bathroom was large though. Besides the room being small, I was very underwhelmed, There was no "cool" factor like other W's in the city that I have stayed at. The walls were stark white and it felt like I was in a hospital. The staff was very nice. The views of Ground Zero (from the lobby) are amazing. The restaurant, BLT was pretty standard. Overall just an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay and super helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: coachbrez
Reviews.Content: My wife, two boys and I stayed for just one night over Thanksgiving weekend using Starwood points. We arrived late - around 10pm - and it looked like the hotel was closed (entrance on Washington St. was dark and no one outside.) I popped into the foyer and immediately a doorman/bellman, Richie, was out to greet me and assist us. He could not have been more pleasant, accommodating and helpful. He made our stay with his wonderful demeanor and friendliness, offering unbelievably above-and beyond help with parking, as well as unloading our bags, recommendations for breakfast, etc.! Every hotel should have a Richie! The hotel was very modern and funky; the room spacious, we felt, for New York. Our room on the 22nd floor directly overlooked the WTC site. It was fascinating and sad at the same time. We could hear the construction noise, but it stopped at 11pm (it began again in the morning, however it wasn't so bad.) We called the concierge (Tela - sp?) after checking in seeking help in obtaining passes to visit the 9/11 Memorial the next day. She could not help us then as tix were not available, but said to call the concierge in the morning. I spoke with Kareem the next morning and, to our surprise, he was able to obtain tickets for us, as well as the family members we were visiting (9 in total!) He was extremely pleasant and helpful! The tix were for different admission times a half-hour apart, but he said it shouldn't be a problem. However, he noted that if when we got there they gave us a hard time he said to call him and he would come across the street and speak with the WTC staff. An amazing offer of service! We checked out of our room and stored our luggage for much of the day before returning to find Richie again who shlepped our luggage - more than a block away - to load our car. Although we were only there for one night, we enjoyed our stay tremendously and felt very well-cared-for. We will be back (and hope that Richie and Kareem are still there!)

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for a W.”
Reviews.Author: Ellen C
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and great access to the subways. In addition to the noise from the WTC construction site I found several things to be a bit annoying since I expected a little more class from the W. We stayed 4 nights and not once were the minibar and toiletries replenished (although after reading the paperwork in the room I read that the minibar is restocked upon request. Really??). If you want wifi in your room that is an additional cost and the BLT restaurant I found to be very over priced for the food quality. Also, the service was not the best. They brought the wrong appetizer and when we ordered a second round of drinks they didn't arrive until after the check arrived. The most unbelievable part of our stay was the offer of a free ride within certain parameters of the city in the hotel's Acura. We booked it for my daughter's trip to Penn Station. It was a sales job!!! They had her watch an infomercial and tried to sell her the car!!!! Beyond tacky. I wouldn't recommend this hotel and have serious reservations about booking other W's. I didn't expect to be nickeled and dimed at a W.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: muster t
Reviews.Content: It was reccomended to us as the hot spot in N.Y. The disappointing was very big. We could not sleep the entire night.The next morning we asked to give us another room on the quite side of the bulding.This was the answear from the front office manager.They cannot help us.He wont comp the room fro the last night. We will never return to this hotel.We will not reccomend it to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: marctor
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Andaz before and vowed never to stay elsewhere in NYC - however, couldn't resist trying a deal from Hotwire. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that I was getting a room at the W downtown, but after reading several reviews I wasn't sure anymore if it had been a good decision - it turned out it really was a good deal! Arrived at the hotel before noon and was not only promptly given a room but was also upgraded to a king room with incredible views of the World Trade Center memorial. Javon (sorry if spelling is wrong), at the reception desk, was extremely polite and efficient and my experience with the other staff was always great. Room was a decent size, washroom a little small but fine. Room was very sterile but I'd been told W's are like that and I didn't really mind it - it did feel that the materials used in the construction were a little cheap looking, but again, didn't bother me. Bed and pillows were incredible, the best I've seen in any hotel. I was on the 18th floor and besides a bit of noise during the day from construction at the WTC site, nights were absolutely quiet. Location is great, a very short walk from Rector Street station and with direct access to all attractions in Manhattan. A couple of restaurants around that were convenient for breakfast and a late night snack, but in general area is quiet in the evening (not necessarily a bad thing). My only problem with the hotel was the dark (and I mean really dark) lounge area leading to the elevators. Honestly, it's borderline ridiculous that the design team thought it was a good idea not to have any lights there - luckily I had checked in during the day so learned my way around..... Internet in the rooms was quite pricey but free wifi in the reception area was fine. Overall a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks to Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: virtue
Reviews.Content: Not at all deserving of the 4 1/2 stars they claim. New, yes, but the finish construction in our room was no better than a lousy roadside chain. Nothing "hot" about it-the place was empty on a Saturday night-and the accomodations are one step above a college dorm room. The designer should be unemployed; very poor space planning. We are both Starwood Gold and were not upgraded. Check-in lengthy as they were understaffed. Missed the Ground Zero experience because the concierge didn't know what she was talking about. No bellman showed when we called for help on check-out. All around, a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hot hotel not a grand dame of NYC”
Reviews.Author: malcolmholoholo
Reviews.Content: If you want a stuff hotel stay at the crowne uptown like i usually did to go to the un, shows and big musuems - oh shopping too. this is lower downtown and the crowd and design of W is hip hop chic. the construction goes on next door after all it is the trade center and the time table is behind time, but the major stuff people below complained about are gone. taxis troll outside - had one follow me for a fare. the lobby is up on the 5th but i was told the ground space is so you can undress on a very cold nyc day first. the "living room" is your check-in, bar, terrace which was closed, why i dont know. the decor looks like inside of the belly of a whale - now at nite it is dark and boomy with trendy music so if you are checking in adjust your eyes before wondering to fin the lift. just this scene should tell you this is a very different sort of starwood property and if you want a sheraton why are you here? the hall ways are narrow to max property i guess. i was up graded to a corner room - opposite side of trade center so i didnt get that view nor i guess the noise. the panel of windows was remarkable - i could catch a glimpse of the river and trade center. at first the room looks small but it is larger for an urban downtown city. it is very modern and trendy design - no lounge chairs - window box cushions you snuggle up to the window. i had a very long flight so the bed was very comfortable. shower was good - yes if you are older and don't have your things in a hanging bag you would have to put them in the draw below the sink. bathrobes nice so your outside neighbors don't see you in the nude. and you know this is for the ipod generation because the clock is a nice player. oh i dont recall a hotel print or painting on the walls - well there is hardy any wall space to talk of. as spg guest there was a nice (free) reception in the living room. nibbles were free so i cant run them down as were the drinks. reminds of the starwood club floors. oh yes and it is in the living room you get free wifi. there is a room charge for wifi - don't do it. century 21 is near by, hardy a show in the area, better restaurants are further away - you need to do your homework on that - occupy wall street mob just a walk away, trinity and st paul's and of course the trade center. you need to get a "pass" from the visitors' center near century 21 to get in line to get in. its free but a walk away. the emotion was high as it was when i was just in berlin. overall: it was nice to feel very young again at the W. it is not a place for old farts - go uptown we are usually there around the park anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you live on the west coast - they will give your room away”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M
Reviews.Content: I live in SF and know that when traveling to NYC I would arrive at mid night. I booked my reservation through http://hotels.com and paid for the entire stay upfront, several months before my arrival. The reservation also included a note to the hotel indicating that I would be arriving at midnight and I called http://hotels.com to confirm that the note would be sent to the hotel. I also received a copy of the reservation where there was indeed a note that I would arrive at midnight. So after a 5 hour flight from SFO I arrived at the W hotel at midnight only to learn that the hotel had given away my room. That's right, the room that I had paid for upfront had been given away and now they were going to "walk" me to another hotel. What they really meant by "walk" me was to put me in a cab to New Jersey, yep that's right they had the cab drive me to another hotel in another state. The next day when I returned to the W downtown I received a message that the hotel wanted to make up for the situation and turn my stay around and that they were going to send me up a package. For 2 days and 3 calls to the "Whatever whenever" front desk we finally got our "let's make this better package" - a bottle of water and a plate with 1 orange, 1 apple, 1 banana, 1 kiwi fruit. Yep, that was supposed to make the stay better after giving away my fully paid room and shipping me to New Jersey. I usually stay at the Marriott, Farimount or Four Seasons and in my 12 years of traveling for work (and pleasure) I've never had my room given away. Unfortunately this was my first time at a W hotel and it will definitely be my last. The hotel itself is in poor condition - carpet pulling away from the walls and a constant stench. It smells like an old hotel that is trying to cover up the old hotel smell by spraying something to try to make it better, but the old smell with the spray makes a stink. It reminded me of someone with BO trying to hide it by overloading on aftershave. AWFUL - STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE, there are plenty of better NYC hotels in the same price range

Reviews.Title: “business in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: bl s
Reviews.Content: during a recent business trip to Manhattan, the staff at the W downtown were a breath of fresh air. Scott, front dest manager, Troy bell ca, Fermin welcome ambassador, Claudio and Nam at the door. Even Monica and Bella housekeeping were a pleasure. I will forgo my uptown hotel for this service anytime. Barbara S. and Mark M.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay, beautiful rooms, great service.”
Reviews.Author: chicagowl
Reviews.Content: I love this place except for the location, not ideal for weekend stays but that is when you get the deals at this w location (kinda far from soho, times square, tourist spots). Not too bad of a cab ride though and door people will hail you a cab promptly. Excellent location for business travels. Very clean, super comfortable, very friendly staff. The bars and restaurants at the hotel are good with great service (but when you run out of olives and someone orders a $25 martini, please have someone run down to the corner market and grab a jar!). Rooms were surprisingly big for Manhatten, very modern, everything you could need or want in the room. Would definitely be a top choice if traveling to NYC for business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for Downtown Financial District”
Reviews.Author: WINEandTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: The New W hotel here aims to please. Offers the typical cool, laid back W attitude/service that is a little more style over substance, but still fine. The rooms are on the small side, which is a common W thread, so no surprise here. Nice little touches show they care... complimentary car service (by appointment), ordered room service and they added a Dylans Candy chocolate bar to the tray as a nice surprise. Hotel is right across from the WTC bldg so lots of construction and sometimes streets may be blocked. Location can be a bit tricky to get to from some directions. All in all, a good option if you want to be in that area. It's close to the Ritz Carlton, which is a bit more money... and in a little less congested area. I'd look at both (ie. rates) before booking either for a comparison. Food option better at the Ritz, but W is ok... not as fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Yessssss!”
Reviews.Author: SylviesMama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be strategically in place for the 5 Borough Bike Ride, New York's nod to spring and the great outdoors. The hotel is gorgeous, with a front row seat at Groubd Zero but the staff was absolutely spectacular. Spec-ta-cular! They ferried our bikes up and down to and from th front door, hustled us cabs, sent drinks to the room and in general, acted as if they were personal assistants instead if desk clerks, doormen and oom attendants. Unbelievable! We had a wonderful wonderful time and now, irrespective of what we're doing in New York, we'll never stay anywhere but The W Hotel Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, dark and noisy”
Reviews.Author: bgold7a
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless your room does not overlook the world trade construction area. Unfortunately, at least half the rooms do. It is all night construction and my two colleagues and I all were awake by 3.45 to 4 AM and had no chance of getting back to sleep. To make things worse, the lobby is essentially unlit so that at 7 AM it is too dark to read the paper or talk to anyone. Looks like a bad Vegas show room

Reviews.Title: “Mod and chic”
Reviews.Author: wannabefoodieHouston
Reviews.Content: Not the most convenient of the W properties. It does face directly over the 9/11 Memorial. But, the traffic of people going there makes it difficult to get in or out of the area. Not to mention it is in the heart of the Financial District, if you try to get out of the area for dinner, good luck with that. The nearest subway station is at least 4 blocks away. You can try to wait for a cab, but it's infrequent. Best bet, go down to Marriott on West Ave and go to the taxi line. Better yet, go across the street, there's alot of cab drop off and it's easier to pick up a cab there. The hotel does have a drop off service that goes as far uptown as 82nd street, but it's essentially a glorified sale pitch they partnered with Acura, which they show you a little video and ask you to fill out a feedback card. They do ask you make a reservation ahead of time, you can chance it last minute. If you do have a chance to check out the balcony bar, you should, it's awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallet at the W”
Reviews.Author: Jaypowen
Reviews.Content: This hotel charged me $500 for a reservation adjustment five minutes after making the original booking. I got nowhere with the staff over this. A complete fraud. Also the neighborhood surrounding is devoid of nightlife . So many other hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “BLT bar and grill is a great find - really excellent food”
Reviews.Author: Susan8552
Reviews.Content: I stayed in NY for two days in October on a business trip and our hosts treated us to dinner in the upstairs restaurant at the W hotel. We had a semi private area and a set meal - and as I wasn't paying I didn't see the bill but the quality of the food and the service was great. The set meal includes a choice of starters and main courses to share - put on the table "family style" as the Americans called it. We had some really great dishes - a tuna tartare with wasabi starter was excellent and the New York strip steak main perfectly prepared. The wait staff looked after us really well and made suggestions for drinks etc. A great find if you are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-Modern and Unique”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: The newest of New York W Hotel locations offers sleek, modern rooms in a very unique location. It directly overlooks the World Trade Center building site and memorial. The 5th floor lobby includes an observation deck that doubles as an outdoor lounge, offering World Trade Center views unlike any others in the city. If you get a room on a high, north-facing floor, you'll get that, as well as million dollar views of the entire city. While I managed to get an upgraded, corner room, my view wasn't great, but the room itself was fantastic. Decor is very modern - almost Jetsons modern - with stark white walls and white furniture contrasting with chocolate brown carpeting and bathroom tile. The corner room included an L-shaped padded window seat that was a nice bonus for taking in the views. The pros for this hotel: 1. Easily accessible by subway. Take the A Train from the Howard Beach station to the Fulton street exit. The hotel is about 4 blocks away. To get pretty much anywhere uptown, take the 1 train at the Rector street station around the corner. There are several subway stations in the area, but this one is closest. 2. Swanky lobby with cool bar, observation deck and evening DJ. Order drinks, order food, see and be seen. 3. Comfortable room with great bedding. Bathroom has a big shower with dark tile that almost looks like brown leather. Try to get on a high floor. Even if you don't face uptown, the views can be excellent, regardless. 4. If you're visiting the 9-11 Memorial, the entrance is literally across the street. Be sure to reserve your entry time in advance. The cons: 1. The only downside to the room was that I thought the bathroom lighting was kind of dim. 2. Now that the 9-11 Memorial is open, there are a LOT of people in this part of town. The Wall Street area used to be very quiet on the weekends because there isn't a ton of tourist stuff to see. That's changed. 3. Construction noise is constant during the day, including Saturday. The hotel is so close to the WTC site, you hear it all. However, they stop at night, so sleeping isn't an issue. But don't plan on a peaceful afternoon nap. 4. There aren't very many good dining or shopping options in this part of town. But it's so easy to get to all of the great neighborhoods by subway, that didn't really matter to me. Subway is definitely quicker than a cab through the narrow, clogged streets in this area. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It's a very different experience than you would get versus staying in the Times Square area, which is so tourist focused. I'd prefer to be away from all of that unless going to a show or dinner. Aside from the WTC, you're also closer to the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge and not too far from SoHo. The hotel can also offer some pretty good rates during non-peak times. Be sure to check spg.com.

Reviews.Title: “The W New York Downtown needs to Regroup!”
Reviews.Author: janiecap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Downtown, NYC on September 16-18, 2011. I really don't know how to explain our experience. We arrived late because we were driving from the Boston area. When we arrived, we were greeted cordially by a doorman and escorted to the lobby on the 5th floor. When we arrived on the 5th floor, there was an incredible blast of music! The music was somewhere between disco and rap. My husband and I owned a discotheque for six years, so we were not too shocked. What were disconcerting were the lights on the curved ceiling that reflected off the floor. The experience was not good. We had to navigate to the next set of elevators. The optical Illusion was not comfortable; we felt like we were drunk. At first, we thought since we're older than the target demographic, we couldn't make a fair evaluation. However, after talking with young people (late twenties to forties), they felt the same way. They told us that they were upset and disoriented by the lights, music, and layout of the hotel. Our room 2211 was clean but extremely small. The bed was very comfortable and probably the best part of our stay. The bathroom had very little space. There was nowhere to put a toothbrush or any cosmetics. Maybe, this would be a great room for a single business person. If you would like to see how you look before proceeding to a meeting, you would wonder, where is the mirror? It's on the backside of the closet door. If you open the closet door, lean against the other door, and you're really thin you might be able to see yourself. We stayed at the W in Boston, and it was one of the best experiences in our lives. The "W" NYC Downtown needs to take a look at what other "W" hotels do. Our children live in NYC, and we visit often. This was our first stay at the W Downtown NYC. We won't be back. The location was bad; the streets and sidewalks were blocked off due to construction. We couldn't even take a walk. We were trapped like rats in a maze. Our advice to the "W" Downtown is to: 1. Expand your target demographic and redesign the lobby and guest rooms to meet the needs of a more diverse clientele. All guests whether they are 20 or 60 want a quiet, clean, comfortable place to relax. I believe all travelers, business people, and tourists want the same thing. 2. Put a shelf in the bathroom so guests can store their toiletries. 3. Install a full-length mirror on the outside of the closet door. 4. Repaint in the guestrooms and hallways—this would freshen up and brighten up these areas. 5. Work out a plan with the cab companies to actually come down the street for customers. Your doorman told us to just go take the subway! 6. Visit some great hotels in the area like the Andaz and Gild Hall to pick up some pointers. 7. Rearrange the elevator configuration. Going up five floors to the lobby is not a good plan. Guests should not have to wangle their way from the check-in desk, go across the dance floor, and walk in front of the DJ to get to the next bank of elevators which will eventually take them to their rooms. 8. Tone down the elevator music. Find music that is appealing to all. 9. Supply the correct email address when sending out a survey. GMWolfgang.Wehen@whotels.com is not a valid email address. The email gets returned. Remove the GM—we called to get the correct address. Unfortunately, you cannot change your location! Maybe in about ten years when the construction has stopped this will be a good location. Sincerely, Mike and Jane (Starwood Preferred Guests) The GM, Wolfgang Wehen, actually read and responded to our concerns. This is a step in the right direction! Retrain or fire you current employees. Focus point: Customer Service. I think in this economy you will be able to find people who actually understand and believe in the adage: The customer is always right!

Reviews.Title: “Tunnel to Towers Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynniebra
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be any more lovely. From the moment you step onto the curb and are greeted to the check in, the staff could not be more accommodating or lovely. The hotel handled our group of 44 effortlessly. Convenience to WTC and Tunnel to Towers activities was incredibly. This part of town is coming into its own and this hotel makes it all the more exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: rama9998
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, right across the WTC site. I got the 15th floor, so got a hgreat view of the monument and the site. In spite of the work going on, it was very quiet inside the room. Very spacious and well furnished. Will stay agin if visiting downtown. Will definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not so wonderful”
Reviews.Author: skipperdog-7
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip where we stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park, and in The W in Union Square. How unfortunate that we stayed at The Ritz first! What an poor contrast for the W. My review for the W is as follows: The lobby is kitschy and attractive, but with a strong dose of citrusy potpourri that I didn't care for. The hallways have a most unpleasant dirty carpet smell that they try to cover up with air freshener, and are dark and dingy. The whole hotel had a humid feeling that wasn't appealing. Our $3,000.00 per night "extreme wow suite" looked nothing like the photos on line. I realize that there are different suites, but the decor in ours was pretty dated. It was muggy and stuffy when we opened the door. The tub was clean, but there was dirt in the grout around the tub and shower in the bathroom. Not what you expect to see for that kind of money. Also, it is very small. They told us when we booked that the room would sleep 6 people. There is ONE queen-sized bed, ONE bathroom, and a small living room with stained, not-so-fresh smelling furniture. They brought in 3 roll-away beds for us with fresh, clean sheets, but they had lumpy mattresses, and because fire safety laws limit the rollaways to 3, one person had to sleep on that couch. The patio is large and beautiful, but the cushions on the outdoor furniture were sun-faded and grimy, and one of the planters smelled as though the last guests urinated in it. There is very dim lighting out there, also. If there were another bathroom, it would be a fine place to have a party, with the large balcony, and great sound system, but then your guests would have to leave because there is no place for them to sleep. About the amenities:They knew they had 6 guests coming, and there was ONE 2 inch bar of nice smelling soap, and one each of some sample toiletries. Come on, not even a separate dinky bar of soap for the sink, shower and tub? One roll of toilet paper on the spindle and another far away in the hall closet. Two wine glasses, and a few champagne flutes with fingerprints on them. One of the wine glasses had lipstick on it. They gave us a bowl of beautiful green apples in the living area, and the one I took off the top was delicious. The ones on the bottom had brown rotten spots with mold in the centers on the underside, leading me to believe that the service staff replaces only the apples on top between guests, leaving the bottom ones until they ferment. A word about how that "whatever, whenever" slogan : Baloney. The concierge never answered the phone him or herself the whole time we were there. You are expected to leave a message. I decided against room service after seeing the moldy apples, and went down to the continental breakfast at the bar area. I found the domes that contained the baked goods smeared with fingerprints, so I chose a yogurt. I asked for honey to top it, and was told they had it, but then they couldn't find it. The clerk sighed, and said she COULD run downstairs and get it, IF I wanted to wait. I did not, seeing as how it took 10 minutes to purchase a cup of yogurt. I found some of the staff friendly, but some sullen, as though they were tired of listening to the complaints of their customers. Friendly or not, the service is quite slow. All in all, I thought this hotel seemed to be a dated partiers crash-pad type of place, and not at all what I expected for the money. I was excited to come here, and tried hard to like it, but I didn't.

Reviews.Title: “24-hour construction ruins the hipster vibe”
Reviews.Author: wrdywmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-September. If noise is an issue, ask about what side of the hotel your room is on. Our room faced the Ground Zero construction site (which was very sad to look at, because it constantly reminded us of the great tragedy there). Construction goes on 24 hours a day. That's right, they run that pile driver all night. Other than that, the room was contemporary and nice. The bar/lounge/lobby area was very comfortable. Again, if you're looking for something low-key, this is not it; they have a DJ in the lounge most afternoons/evenings. The concierge gave us some excellent suggestions for a cool bar and great Chinese restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Intersting Place, Great Location, OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: karyn m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 15-18, 2011. The hotel is in a good location. Is is right beside the WTC area. The hotel terrace overlooks current construction going on at Ground Zero. This may be a plus or minus, depending on how you look at it. We thought it was really neat to see this in progress and the construction noise didn't bother us, although you could definitely hear it all through the night (just didn't bother us). After all WTC construction is complete, the view will be amazing. The hotel sits just south, so rooms on the north side would give the best views of WTC. The hotel is right around the corner from the Rector St. train (lines 1 & R). It's easy to get around the financial district on foot and midtown Manhattan is very accessible via the Rector St. trains. The area seemed very safe and there were plenty of small restaurants nearby. There are delis and cafes and pizza places unique to NYC and a Burger King, Starbucks and Subway all just a short walk from the hotel. If you are visiting The Statue of Liberty from Battery Park, the ferry station is also a very short walk from the hotel. It would probably take longer to take the train. The hotel's BLT Grill has very good food but it's very expensive. We ate there one night and our bill for two ran about $140. The food was VERY GOOD. The service was not great. The waiters were friendly enough, just seemed to be overworked/busy and our food took forever, glasses were not filled, I received a white wine when I ordered a red, etc. The hotel's interior is very artsy in a youthful contemporary way. A lot of attention to detail is given. When you enter the elevator, the floor mat will say GOOD MORNING in the morning, GOOD AFTERNOON in the afternoon and GOOD EVENING at night. The rooms also looked as if they were designed by an art student. I was pleased with the look and everything was very clean. The room was EXTREMELY small. That was fine with us. There were two of us and with a king size bed, we had just enough walking space for luggage. Speaking of the bed, it was VERY COMFORTABLE. It was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever experienced! I liked the down pillows and comforter. There were marks on the wall as I've seen in several reviews. The hotel is very new and it did look older than it is. I have 2 small kids and have lived where I do 10 years and my walls are less marred. So, they probably should give the rooms a new paint job. There were two things that bothered me about the room. One was, the bathroom door (which was a sliding door) required TWO PEOPLE to close it and it was only with great effort at that. Another issue I had was that there is a red light which stays on in the closet. It looks really cool when you open it HOWEVER, at night, when your lights are off, you can see a little light coming out of the closet. That was a little annoying/distracting. Other than that, it was nice and comfortable and seemed safe, just not as new looking as it should look and small. By the way, the bathroom was a decent size, it was only the bedroom that was micro. One more thing I'll add... You can get internet access for your room for about $15/night. We wanted that but didn't realize, it was not $15 for the whole hotel room but for every single device we had on the internet. We had a laptop, an iPad, a GPS device and an iPad Touch and we accessed the internet with all 4 devices which cost us $60/night - ugg. So, watch out for that.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy modern hotel looking down on ground zero.”
Reviews.Author: karoLondon
Reviews.Content: An enjoyable stay for our family of four with pre teen kids. Not really a family hotel but v cool and rock n roll. We all liked it. Great rooms, service. Not a very big hotel. Reception on 5th floor. Complimentary taxi to uptown whilst we stayed. Complimentary coffee and wi fi in lobby. Location is a little away from the hustle and bustle of 5th ave and time sq. But we liked that. It's virtually on wall St, near the ferry terminal for station island and statue of liberty. Plus you can explore all the places in between downtown and central park. great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “WTC overview has pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: yellowpixels
Reviews.Content: Half of the Downtown W overlooks the WTC site. Great views of the entire site. Unfortunately with construction going 24x7 you can also get the sounds and lights. I still recommend this property - if you like the W ambiance, you will like this hotel. Relatively new property. Great location for the financial district.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: lcjt01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W NYC Downtown one weekend in April 2011. I love the W Hotels so I always make sure to stay at a W if the city has one because the W Hotels are not your ordinary hotel. The lobby is not on the ground level, it's up on the 5th floor where the bar is located at. This hotel is right across the street from the 9/11 memorial and they have a balcony that you can view the site at your sit and have some drinks late at night outside. The bed was comfy, the view from my room was fantastic. I only had 4 issues, (1) the bathroom lighting was not the best when I went to put on my makeup; after my stay, I did notify the hotel of the bathroom issue. They are aware that the lighting is not that great and said they would look at how to make things better for the femal guests (2) my safe was not working so make sure your safe is working or ask for another room; (3) my last issue was the Friday night really late, a couple of the guests were really loud from their room so it was hard to get any sleep that one night; (4), I went to use their internet system to log onto my computer, I had trouble getting to my email account to check my flight information and no matter what I did I could not get to the website and I still got charged for it. Very frustrating so don't use their internet service unless you absolutely have to. The staff was friendly and always had a smile on their face, very helpful. This hotel is within walking distance of the Statue of Liberty and the financial district. There is a Starbucks around the corner. The hotel food was not that bad, but since this is NYC go out and find a nice restaurant to eat at. Since I didn't do alot of sight seeing, the hotel restaurants are pretty good and if you need a taxi, the bellhops will grab you one immediately. Again, I do love the W Hotels so I would always recommend a W Hotel and you can always buy the W products that are in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “NYC trip”
Reviews.Author: AndreyK3
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in NYC. Great condition to travel with pet. Free wi-fi for SPG guests huge +

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from a W”
Reviews.Author: FlyingHigh060
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to be staying at a W, as I am a huge Starwoods fan and have stayed at the W in Midtown and had a wonderful experience. Unfortuently, I was very disappointed with what I saw at the Downtown location. I was upgraded to a corner room on the 8th floor - not a great view. The room was small, and there were black scuff marks on ALL of the walls. While I realize that travelers have suitcases and are not always careful with the rooms - the W is a luxury hotel chain and they should at least attempt to fix things like this. I also had a few additional quams with my stay - no full length mirror, the door to the bathroom was a "pocket-door", the hair dryer was old and didnt work very well - no ear-swabs/cottenballs on the sink - again if this was a Sheraton or an Element - I would have been satisfied with my stay - but this is a W - when I'm paying for a superior experience - I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but fun”
Reviews.Author: Bugfast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a combination business/pleasure trip. I had never stayed at a W before although have stayed at many Starwood properties before. This hotel is not for everyone but it is for alot of people, myself included. It is in the financial district so there is not alot going on in the general area for tourists, but if you are a tourist and are aware of that, then you will have no problem. You will need to take the elevator up to get to the check in area and then another set of elevators to get to the rooms. The hotel is entirely non smoking and has great views from some of the rooms, especially of the Ground Zero and memorial area. The fitness center was well appointed and I had it to myself most of the time. The rooms are bright and well appointed with ammenities for both business and pleasure. For example. there was candy from Dylan's but also highlighters in the desk should I need them. I was upgraded to a Corner Cool room which means I had wrap around windows. The room is really not different from other rooms. This hotel is definately not traditional so therefore, not for everyone however if you like Ws and something a bit different and are aware you are in the Financial District, then you will like this hotel. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if working in Downtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: HUTraveler02
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you are working downtown or doing business at one of the World Financial Buildings. I enjoyed the room amenities and great service at the hotel. This W surely meets the trendiness you expect to receive at a W. The only drawback of staying at the hotel was the noise throughout the night. I know it is not the hotels fault, but even on the 19th floor I could still hear the construction down below throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel and bad service”
Reviews.Author: hopefiona
Reviews.Content: Very noisy as 24 hour building site operating across the road on the world trade centre site- stay here only if you don't wish to sleep. Staff very unhelpful. Computers and phone system continually down. Far from everything and not many dinig options close by. give this hotel amiss.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff in a trendy hotel with potential to be great”
Reviews.Author: ilovemanhattanNyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 3.5, but Trip Advisor won't let me do that. It is a cut way above the W in Leicester Square, but it is below the W Riverfront in Chicago, the W Hollywood, the W Los Angeles, etc. It is all about trendy, but in an odd spot for trendy.
