Wall Street isn't trendy, so this sticks out and brings a breath of fresh air. Having BLT is great. Not having a Bliss is not, but there are Bliss products in the rooms. The hotel suffers from having 1/2 its rooms facing the World Trade Center site and the hole occupying the site of the Deutsche Bank building, which finally came down earlier this year. The hotel does have blackout shades if you are on that side, so you aren't bothered by the 24/7 (no kidding, they work those hours for real) work on the Trade Center site. When the construction is done, these rooms will be fantastic. The rooms here are palaces compared with those at the W Leicester Square, which shows the difference in customer service and attitude. Hotel rooms in both London and NYC are small, but there is a huge difference. There is also a difference in the attitude of the staff. Here they are warm and helpful. They aren't top-notch or as accommodating as at other Ws, but they are better than average and than at the W in London. Great beds, as usual. I was surprised that BLT, which is great, doesn't provide room service and that you have to go down to get it as "carry out." I was surprised my request to have the lightbulb replaced in the make-up mirror didn't happen. I was surprised the hotel didn't have any washcloths available at 8pm on a Friday night - they were waiting for laundry to come back. I was surprised the 5th floor balcony/terrace isn't open for breakfast. It would be a great place to just chill and have your coffee, but I was told they had to wait for it to dry because it was slippery. I was surprised a washcloth in my room was stained/dirty. Probably the most surprising was the wear & tear on this hotel, as it is just over a year old! Because it is dark each and every nick and bang shows. The marred surfaces show on the mouldings, doors and sides of the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BSCMDA
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is localized on the Financial District of NYC, Downtown. We stay on a weekend on a special rate. We were expecting no activity during this time of the week since the major activity should be on weekdays/ business hours. To our surprise, it was crowded and with a lot of tourism. The Hotel lobby is actually on the 5th floor with a view to the ground zero new construction. It was sad to see the area were so many people died on 0911. The terrible attack that change our history forever!. The room was small, with modern/ minimalistic decoration. The bed was very comfortable and all the amenities and services that characterizes W Hotels. Our returning flight was late evening and we asked for a later check up. To our surprise they let us stay until 400 pm w/o extra charge! This worked perfect for us, we were able to rest before our scheduled delayed flight . I highly recommend this hotel, although is not in the Center; close to Times Square, like most of the visitors prefers to stay. If you look somewhere out of this busy area, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Factor lives”
Reviews.Author: mbmuscle
Reviews.Content: I always love visiting this hotel, I have stayed here many times, most for business and several fun visits. I love the lobby and decor, this is a stunning property, I like this design and decor the best in Manhattan. I also like the noise level, just right, super clean with a very nice health club. Staff is outstanding, I base this on my many visits to W Hotels around the country

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel - Service so-so, Ground Zero Construction Annoying”
Reviews.Author: ldiggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August with my partner. Had previously visited the bar and decided it would be nice to stay here since it's in a good area and the price was pretty reasonable for New York. The hotel is very flashy which I expected, with a nice, upscale bar that overlooks the Ground Zero construction site. I can only imagine that once the construction is completed the price on the rooms at this hotel is going to skyrocket. With that said, the first thing I noticed when we arrived early in the morning on Friday was that the construction at Ground Zero was very loud, and could easily be heard in the room when the air conditioning wasn't off. Thankfully the construction ceased on Friday evening until we left on Sunday, but I would definitely reconsider staying here if you have trouble falling asleep to the sound of constant jackhammers. I originally tried to move to a room on the opposite side of the hotel but was told they could not accommodate the request because there was no availability. The hotel restaurant is very pricey (spent about $30 on an appetizer and a beer for lunch), and the bar is expensive as well (think $17 martinis) but it's a cool vibe and a nice place to hang out with friends at a modern, cutting edge location. The room was a bit on the smaller side for the price (though maybe not for New York) at about 350 square feet. I was surprised to find that for a brand new hotel, there were a TON of markings all over the wall, as if they had somehow been scuffed during construction and were never cleaned up. My only other qualm I have with the hotel is that, while the service was generally good, it wasn't exactly the type of deferential treatment you expect when paying for a hotel of this price. For example, one day I called down to reception to request turndown service, to which the front desk person responded in an obnoxious, quizitive tone, "turndown?", as if she had never heard of it before. Clearly she had because she went on to inform me that they could only do turndown after 5, and that I had just checked in. I had to explain to her that I had people coming over and wanted the room to be clean. Not that big a deal, but at any other high end hotel, this would not have been such a long conversation. Another issue I had was on one of the nights I had a few people in my room and apparently someone called management on us for being too loud. A manager came by and told us to quiet down, which is fine and totally understandable, except that she rebuked us for having been told to quiet down 3 times. I found this incredibly frustrating/annoying considering that was the first time we had heard from anyone, and we had only just walked into the room about 15 minutes earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, trendy hotel in downtown New York”
Reviews.Author: NickKosky
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here while our daughter was on film camp. We booked through discount website and got a room with a view over the 9/11 heritage site with 2 double beds. The beds were very comfortable and the room well appointed. No bath but great shower and the best shampoo. Nice flat screen Tv but problems with signal feed meant that we weren't charged for the film. Staff were all greaty and patient with NYC first timers. Nearest subway 5 minute walk. The area is under development so is noisy in the day but quiet at night. A great hotel. - really. Shout out to Nicole and Kareem on the front desk in particular. Just remember - get the lift up to the lobby to check in; it's not on the ground floor. The lobby is more like a nightclub than a hotel - you'll feel most comfortable wearing black!

Reviews.Title: “Great new W in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Brent B
Reviews.Content: The staff bent over backwards for us and the new space has a lot of bells and whistles. It is your typical funky, eclectic W hotel. Worth checking out if you want to stay downtown. It is right across the street from Ground Zero, so it can be a little heavy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Had higher expectations for the W”
Reviews.Author: sstringe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W for the weekend. We booked the reservation through hotwire. The staff was friendly when we arrived. They accommodated my request for a south facing room to avoid the WTC construction. The room, a corner room, which I think is supposedly a bit bigger than their average room still seemed small even for NY standards. Even though the hotel is new, there was something about it that just didn't quite meet my expectations for a 4.5 star. There were pencil markings on the wall, looked like lines drawn for leveling the headboard I guess from when the bed was installed. There were a few patches on the wall, the room and the pillows had a light odor..like there had been a wet dog there before or someone had smoked in it. The location, while I knew it was not a lively area I did not realize it would be as sleepy as it was. A bit of hike to the areas North (the Village) where the vibe is a little more exciting and there are interesting places to shop, eat and drink. I never ate or drank at the hotel but I did try to get a drink of water from the bar when we got home Saturday night (12:00/12:30ish) but it was closed. I asked the front desk if I could get some water or if there was a vending machine. I was informed that there was no vending machine but that there was some place on each floor that dispensed water, I found the ice maker, but not the water [maybe I misunderstood]. Water was available in the room for a $8 bottle but I was unwilling to fork over that much mula for H2O.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dated”
Reviews.Author: Anglotraveller
Reviews.Content: Positives-good location for downtown business, good value for money for NY, very friendly staff. Negatives-interior is in dire need of an upgrade; it is dated and feels run down. If you decided to stay at the hotel, ask for a room away from the elevators, it gets noisy in the early hours of the morning as people return from their night out.

Reviews.Title: “Bad services”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in our stay at the W New York Downtown. We were two adults and two children ages 7 and 9 and we had booked for two double beds and when we arrived after several hours of driving, we are informed that this is not possible because there is no room available with two beds. They proposed a room with a king size bed. We refuse and demand two beds. After several minutes with the clerk at the reception, she proposes the addition of a rollaway bed for our two daughters. I ask for another one and we were told that this is impossible because there is not enough space. The bed provided is clearly inadequate to sleep two (even if they are children). At the reception desk, no way to have the service and the clerk is eager to serve other customers. I will not hesitate to post on every forum possible my disappointment and poor quality of service received at the Hotel W. I travel a lot, I have many friends who travel and I have friends that own travel agencies. I will recommend to all not to encourage stays in this hotel chain. Richard Bélanger Angry customer

Reviews.Title: “Still "W"orking it out”
Reviews.Author: SSfamily
Reviews.Content: The new W downtown will have amazing views when the freedom tower is finished but for now it is next to a construction site with all the dust and noice thta conveys. Like other W's you take the elevator up to reception. The rooms are typical in that they are comfortable but kind of small. There is a BLTSteak in this hotel and while the food was pretty good it was expensive and there are far better steakhouses downtown. My overriding sense was the hotel was still on its maiden voyage and was working out the kinks. I am sure given time thta this property will meet the standards the brand usually delivers

Reviews.Title: “Not the best W”
Reviews.Author: YOWboys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New York– Downtown while visiting the city in July 2011. This is an acceptable hotel (though not a credit to the W brand), but I would be unlikely to return to this property. The front desk staff was enthusiastic and helpful at check-in, and once someone arrived at the front desk, he was very efficient at check-out, as well. We were generally greeted by the doormen at the hotel entrance. The fifth-floor lobby of the hotel is a cool appealing and whimsical design, though fairly dark. The shower was the best I have had in a W hotel (combining aspects of the rainfall shower without the anaemic water pressure). Other reviewers have noted noise issues at this hotel, but my room was very quiet. Glimpses of the river could be caught between buildings from the room. These were the high points of our experience at the hotel. Other aspects of the hotel were somewhat disappointing. The room was quite small (even by New York standards), and it should probably have been outfitted with a Queen instead of a King bed. Even with the corner room’s windows (one of which was able to open), it felt very cramped and probably ill-suited for more than one person. The pocket door on the bathroom seemed cheap, but it is unclear whether there would have been clearance for a proper door. Despite having been booked directly through Starwood, this had the feel of the rooms I would get at the Grand Hyatt in New York when I booked through Hotwire/Expedia as a student. At less than one year old, the room in which I stayed was not wearing well. The white walls were scuffed in various places, and there were obvious patches that had been made. There were a couple of drips of water coming out from between the panels underneath the sink. In addition, while the room size is not an issue that can be overcome, I would have expected the room to be slightly cleaner, as there was visible dust in several places when I arrived (including on the mini-bar snack tray items). I was also disappointed that the terrace off of the lobby was closed when I tried to go out in the afternoon and that none of the staff in the area offered any assistance (or even telling us that it was closed) as we tried multiple doors. Finally, this is the first W at which I have stayed where I was overwhelmed by the brand’s signature scent. A friend and I had to literally hold our breath in the elevator from the street level to the lobby at one point. None of these were enough to ruin my stay, but there are certainly better hotels in the area. I expect better of this brand. In this area of Lower Manhattan, I have previously stayed at the Ritz Carlton Battery Park and the Millennium Hilton, and I would recommend the former if you can get a decent rate (it is a couple of blocks further south, but its rooms are quite large with harbour views and telescopes for looking at the Statue of Liberty). I am not normally a huge fan of staying off the island when visiting New York, but given the proximity and convenience of the PATH station (both to the World Trade Centre and the hotel in New Jersey), SPG members needing to be in Lower Manhattan should seriously consider the excellent W Hoboken. The hotel is located across the street from the site of the World Trade Centre. Once the pavilion opens, it will be easier to get around this area (including to the PATH station on the other side). There seemed to be a shortage of taxis on the hotel’s street, but they can be more easily found a couple of blocks to the east. There is a Starbucks across the street from the hotel, and we went to Tribeca to eat because there are not very many options in the immediate vicinity of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay w a family - in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: gouldmanj
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review for now, while I am kept awake in my room that is above the lounge. Unbelievable that they would put a family in this room (especially one that is a rewards member of their program). The noise is so loud - we are hearing both the din of people and the music. This room should be used for young "hip" people that won't be in their rooms until later. NOT RECOMMENDED if you want a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience by WTC”
Reviews.Author: aenimnicht
Reviews.Content: So glad we experienced this W. My 13 year old was with me and previously we had only stayed in Midtown. Our 19th floor room was a little small given we reserved a Spectacular room (it may have been b/c we used points) but had fabulous view of the WTC..we saw them testing the waterfalls in prep for the 9/11/11 opening. The only construction sound problems we had were the night I didn't seal our window shut..ooops! Pros... great concierges..1 block to Subway (a main line)..even on the weekend lots of cafes and shops to get food/drinks w/in 2 blocks...Battery Park super close...amazing view of history in the making. Cons..rooms had a "cool factor" but not the best W finishes..flat paint was scuffed several places...not totally polished.. Great experience overall

Reviews.Title: “A sexier side of downtown”
Reviews.Author: GummyTeeth
Reviews.Content: Downtown was not exactly our first choice for a hotel location, but we got a great deal on Hotwire so we thought we'd give it a shot. The design of the lobby is pure sexy. Black textured walls, a low organic ceiling, and beautiful wrap-around terrace create the sexy design-driven experience you expect from a W. We had one of the Wonderful rooms in the back of the building. A nearly vacant lot allows for tremendous amounts of sunshine through the windows, and the white decor makes the room feel even lighter. I had read reviews about construction noise, but thankfully we stayed here on a national holiday so it was blissfully quiet. The short and sweet: Pros sexy lobby great terrace overlooking WTC memorial (although it just looks like a mess right now) wonderful W bed clean Cons location - very limited for places to eat around here. Though it is walkable to Tribeca. cab deficient sliding bathroom door, as in the old crappy wooden ones that pinch your fingers no HD TV. You expect to have the same or better quality cable as you have at home

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for price”
Reviews.Author: AlanGP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is style over substance. It has the look of an LA nightclub. The decor seems to be designed to shock the senses. I don't mind something different, but I was hoping for a better hotel for business. My room was small (European small) with white walls and a black snake-skin textured carpet. The white color scheme wasn't a good choice. The walls show marks and scuffs. While the bed is nice, the rest of the room doesn't have the quality to match the $380 price. And, as some reviewers point out, you have the noise of WTC construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fair location”
Reviews.Author: Nitzanm4
Reviews.Content: When I came to this hotel, I had very high expectations, since this is a W hotel, and I have a gold Starwood Preferred Guest card. To say that my expectations were met would be an understatement. The hotel was as clean and new as can be, and the service was extraordinary. When I arrived at the hotel, I wanted something to eat, so I went to the BLT Bar and Grill. I ate the filet Mignon, which was great. After my lunch, I checked in. One of the staff members helped me with my luggage, and showed me to my room. Because this is New York, I realised that the rooms would be smaller. However, at the W, this was a nuisance. The rooms are very modern, clean, and efficient. This hotel does have a high price tag, but it is justified. Even though the hotel is located in the middle of the downtown, the whole city is accessible because the W give complimentary rides to about anywhere in the city, in an Acura MDX. I really loved this hotel, and it's location didn't bother me, because there is a subway station less than 700 feet away, and the Acuras can take you anywhere. I definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Experience”
Reviews.Author: travlnmompa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were looking for a downtown location and wanted to use points. The Union Square location required too many points for all the rooms we needed. I thought the location would be too far removed from everything but we ended up loving the location. Quick walk to Tribeca restaurants and we never had a problem getting taxis either. There is so much to do downtown, I never go to midtown anymore. If you have things you need to do in mid or uptown this may not be a good choice. Walked along the Hudson in the morning- just beautiful. Bad part of the location is the sound of construction- it was loud by 8am. The hotel itself is super modern, maybe too modern. We liked the lobby bar for happy hour and the terrace was great. Great spot for a pre-dinner cocktails, esp on Friday. On Saturday they had the elevator and terrace music blasting first thing in the morning. I think it was set at the level from Friday night and no one bothered to turn it down. They didn't do this on Sunday, so either someone complained or a manager finally picked up on it. We were trying to relax with our coffee on the terrace but we couldnt even hear each other talk it was so loud. I just thought it was strange that a manager would allow it. The rooms were so-so...painted white so it showed tons of scuff marks on the walls. They had a worn look already for such a new hotel. Bathrooms were tiny and seemed to have poor construction. Our room had a funny smell...I should have had our room changed but by the time I realized the smell wasnt going away I didn't feel like packing everything back up, etc. The blackout shades allow light in through the sides...this is a MAJOR design flaw!!! Ive never stayed in a hotel that this happened. At 8am it looked like we had spotlights on in our room! If you are looking to sleep in and relax, stay somewhere else. We faced ground zero so maybe if you stay on the south side the light isn't as bad. Cleanliness wasn't an issue and the bed was extremely comfortable. Service was ok, on par with other W's. I feel as a whole W's used to have amazing service but over the last two years they have been average. I believe rooms start around 200$...that is a steal for nyc. I think you can put up with the shortcomings for that price. Don't expect the four seasons when your not paying four seasons rates.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Javintheair
Reviews.Content: Breakfast took too long even though the restaurant was empty and they could not find my order to charge to the room, they had me waiting 10 minutes.... Icould not get into my room because the card wasnt opening the door, I had to go down three times....... took me ten minutes to get into my room, I expected a better service. I asked for a wake up call, I never received it, lucky I had put my Mobile alarm on. When I complained at reception the only response was, ´oh Im sorry¨!!!´ Thats not satisfactory...... I guess I will have to try another hotel in New York to which I travel every month......

Reviews.Title: “deafening noise, no concern for guests”
Reviews.Author: michelingirl
Reviews.Content: not only is this location in "construction hell," the management rents out space to loud, obnoxious parties and has zero concern for their other hotel guests. After calling the desk multiple times with noise complaints and being assured that the party would be over at 9:30... then 10.. then 11pm on a Wednesday (when I had to wake up at 5:30 the next morning!) I finally went out for a walk. Even then, I could still hear the music all the way down the street! Terrible sleep. Terrible service. Terrible location. Only perk was that it is a new building and clean. Overpriced given its brand.

Reviews.Title: “construction hell”
Reviews.Author: itsWindy
Reviews.Content: nin2727 hit it on the head: the W is facing a construction site that never stops. I spent a weekend at the W and was awakened before 7 am on Saturday; deafening noise continued until past 10 p.m. that night. I tried turning up the fan to drown it out and froze from the air conditioning. Beautiful room, friendly and helpful staff, soft sheets, wonderful BLISS products--cannot make up for the noise. This is true of the other hotels facing the giant hole in the ground at Ground Zero, perhaps for the next 3 or 4 years (Club Quarters and likely the Marriott next door). To be avoided for those who care about peace and quiet or sleeping in their hotel rooms. I had prepaid the room so I was stuck. If I hadn't, I'd have left after the first night; I doubt that changing to the other side of the hotel would have made much difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, interesting decor, spotty service--not our best W experience”
Reviews.Author: slg2if
Reviews.Content: First of all, you have to like the W concept to even consider this hotel. The lobby and bar are distinctively decorated (I smiled every time I walked through), but the rooms are stark submarine-like pods. The carpet is dark, the walls are ceiling are the same shade of white, and the only color is a few small dashes of red (piping on a throw pillow). There are no pictures or decoration of any type on the walls, and all lamps and accessories are very high tech looking (though not very functional). If you ask for a room facing Ground Zero, you'll have an awesome view of the construction, as the crews work 24/7 to complete as much as possible by the 10th anniversary on 9/11. (If you don't like the sound of heavy construction equipment at night, ask for a room on the other side.) The W is also located close to Trinity Church, Wall Street and numerous subway stations. In addition, the complimentary Acura Experience service offered by the W is great when you don't feel like taking the subway. Our disappointment with this property was the maintenance and the service. The bathroom tiles looked like leather and snakeskin, but the bathroom layout was not very functional. In addition, every towel rack or hanger in the bathroom was loose and wobbly, so that things literally fell off the walls. While most of the staff members were very friendly and professional, there were some very notable exceptions. One of the concierge staff members was rude and acted like her job would be great if she didn't have to deal with pesky hotel guests--what a bother. In addition, our two experiences with the bar were disappointing. The outside bar overlooks Ground Zero, but you have to put up with indifferent service and ridiculously overpriced (and bad) cocktails. When we sat down in the inside bar on another evening, the staff didn't even acknowledge our presence, so we left without being served. On a positive note, when I mentioned these things to the front desk, they apologized and a manager followed up with an email. Hopefully these issues will be rectified for future guests.

Reviews.Title: “Come on W and Starwood you can do better than this!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Papa
Reviews.Content: My first W experience!! Check in was quick my status allowed me a room upgrade and a free bottle of water plus a car ride to almost anywhere in manhattan. Although not used but it was a nice touch. The lobby was very funky and modern. The rooms were tastefully decorated but be warned that if you face the 9/11 site I could hear the construction at night and if I wasn't so tired it would probably bug me. Upon opening the dufet, found several stained marks on the bed sheets. This was a severe surprise as I did not expect that from a Starwood property!! A quick phone call and 5 minutes later someone came to replace the sheets. No apologies from phone operator or the house cleaning staff which I found strange but I was tired and moved on with my life! Next morning I found stained face towels and asked for a toothbrush but it never came in the 45 minutes after call and had to run to my first meeting. The hotel fell short of my expectations again. I must say that Nicole at the concierge desk went over and beyond to help me locate a plastic bag. She was very pleasant and genuinely tried to locate a bag that would fit the toys for my nephews. I would give her 110% for service excellence. A simple request but she made me feel good! I heard so many good things about the W and I really enjoyed the atmosphere of the hotel from the funky lobby, an elevator that smells nice to chic rooms. But I am very disappointed with the housecleaning staff: stained sheets towels to inconsistent housecleaning staff experience. Come on W Hotel and Starwood you can do better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: aelvish
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the new W Hotel Downtown NYC. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms spacious and comfortable, and the staff exceptionally helpful. Of special note was the desk clerk Jason who made our check in fast and welcoming (and made sure we knew all about the property), and Anari the concierge who was well connected and set us up with fun activities for our Saturday night in the East Village. Despite these two shout outs, I would say that all the staff from housekeeping to doormen were excellent and always made us feel welcome. As it is a W Hotel I would caution people who don't like a lively hotel atmosphere that this may not be for them. But anyone who appreciates a bit of fun, a supremely comfortable room, great views and chic interiors should definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Unique and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: NYWillTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is phenomenal in several respects. We had a view of the World Trade Center construction site. Overlooking the site is still a little creepy but the views beyond were excellent. Attention must have been paid to minimizing noise because the room was relatively quiet and the construction did not affect us. Once construction is completed, the view of the site will be wonderful. The lobby is artfully designed and a great location for hanging out. It seems like an excellent place for meeting friends or for post-shopping for drinks. There is a bar with adequate indoor and outdoor seating that's great for groups. The bar service was not that great but it did offer a relaxed atmosphere and no one rushed us to leave. The rooms were clean, large, and had everything one could need. With few exceptions, the staff was quite accommodating. The room service menu was varied and the food and service were excellent. Strongly recommended. There is an outdoor skating rink adjacent to the lobby that the kids just loved. Otherwise, once we left the hotel, the area was nothing to write home about. Much construction all around. Maybe one day in the not too distant future soon the area near the hotel will be more enjoyable. If you are looking for something different in NYC, quiet, relaxing, away from the hustle and bustle, this W fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money if you need to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: mollybecky
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight for a business meeting the following morning. It's brand new, very trendy with state of the art amenities. Very nice service and an excellent restaurant. Not many shops or attractions in the area, but you're close to the subway which will get you throughout the city. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for Money as It Fails to Deliver Consistent Service”
Reviews.Author: WarmWhite
Reviews.Content: Sofia L. Vandaele, general manager of W New York Downtown, sent us an email upon reservation. “We're looking forward to your arrival," she wrote. The W may have a well-meaning GM, but delivering consistent service isn’t one of its strengths. “Do you have a bell boy here?” we asked a en employee lounging by the entrance “I’m the bell boy!”, he replied, but showed no intention of helping with our luggage until we urged him to do so. The check-in process was pleasant enough, and the concierge was both congenial and chatty. This, however, can’t be said of the bar staff, our next stop. Deeply engaged in conversation when we approached them, the servers didn’t let our presence interrupt their chatting. The bar tenders didn’t seem acquainted with the menu, and couldn’t tell the ingredient of a standard cocktail it contained. And their conversation continued even as they served our drinks. After an enjoyable night at the well-appointed yet quirkily decorated room, we attempted to check out. A humdrum event in most hotel properties, this checkout was a weary experience. It required four or five iterant revisions to our bill, a quest to recover luggage we left earlier, and then multiple phone calls to the hotel after our departure due to mysterious charges to our credit card. Before leaving, we asked to be contacted by the front desk manager. We are still waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find Through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: GreenTravelerMA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire for about $120 on a Saturday night - it would have been an amazing value at twice that price as the hotel is brand new, very well managed and located in the heart of downtown NYC. Some reviews decribe the rooms as small but we found them very reasonable for downtown New York.

Reviews.Title: “W Downtown = a Winner”
Reviews.Author: sonniger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were staying overnight at the W Downtown for a private party at the hotel organized by a local trade organization. The first impression of the W is a combination of amazement and confusion. Amazing because everything is so wonderfully trendy and clean. Nice details are the floor mat in the elevator ("Good morning" "Good afternoon" "Good night" depending on the part of the day) and a welcome note in the room. Confusing because, yes, I'll have to check in on the 5th floor and also have to figure out how to get lighting working in the room (use room key and look for a tiny switch on the bedside lamp). The view from the room on the north side is spectacular: the Ground Zero construction site. Indeed, since construction in going on from early morning till late at night, you may want to ask for a room on the south side if you want to sleep in. Although not the biggest room size I've experience in the city, definitely sufficient, comfortable and very clean. The staff was very friendly, without an exception. Also the restaurant (BLT Bar & Grill) was above my expectations: food was very good and although filled to capacity, we didn't feel rushed out. The W did also everything right to make the private event at night a wonderful experience. The only suggestion to the W would be to include free Wifi. The target customer profile for this hotel are those that want to be connected, all the time. Overall, if you like a trendy Euro style hotel with a lot of attention to customers and details, you'd like this hotel A LOT! Stay away if you're looking for stuffy country style rooms with flower motifs :-)

Reviews.Title: “The W is amazing - will definitely being staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: BerLynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend with a friend. When we first walked in the building we were in awe of the modern and trendy the design of the inside of the hotel. Second reaction- THE STAFF WERE ALL SO FRIENDLY!!!!! We arrived in the morning expecting to store our bags in a room, however, even though check-in is not until 3PM, we were in our room by 10AM - this was a nice surprise. The rooms were great, comfortable bed, and the Ipod docking station is a definite bonus. Had cocktails on the bar patio and the atmosphere was great, bartender so friendly, he even recommended night life that he felt would suit our style and needs. The concierge was great with directions around the city and extremely friendly- you could sense she wanted to help. Finally, the BLT restaurant on the 2nd floor offered a delicious menu, not too expensive with a tasty breakfast. We will be staying here next visit, no question.

Reviews.Title: “So far, the best W experience.”
Reviews.Author: QCInspector
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at quite a number of different W Hotels around the world and this W really makes the experience - WOW. We checked in on a Saturday (over the memorial weekend) at about 7pm. The bellman, Jimmy, was very pleasant and greeted us when we arrived. He was quick to assist us with our luggages and shopping bags (all these filled the trolley all the way to the top). While we were on our way to the 5th level for the check in, he was informing us about the different facilities in the hotel. The front desk staff was helpful and the check in was a swift. Jimmy, the bellman, showed us to the room. He told us that complimentary coffee and tea are available everyday from 630am to 10am. WIFI is free on the 5th level. It's free in the room for the privileged SPG members (if I remember correctly). The gym is on level 3. He continued to tell us more about the restaurant and bars in the hotel. He really impressed me because none of the bellmen that I've come across in any of the W Hotels is as detailed as him. Well done Jimmy! We had the corner room so it's rather quiet (partly because we stayed over the Memorial long weekend). The room is very nice (avoid W at Lexington, it's really not worth the money). And my bathroom does not come with the frosted glass door feature. The gym is consider big when compared to most hotels. And it's well equiped with weights and treadmills. Our package came with compimentary drinks and nibbles at the bar. Even though it's nibbles, some of them can be considered as main courses if you are not a big eater. The nibbles are really good. My favourites are the grilled octopus, shrimp cocktail, crab dip and pappardelle ragu. We were there for three consecutive nights and Cassandra, the hostess, was always very helpful and friendly. She's partly the reason why we decided to host some of our friends at the bar during our stay there. Nicole at the concierge desk was equally helpful. She helped us to book the complimentary ride (advice is to book at least 24 hours in advance). The only thing that I don't like about the hotel is its location. We tried taking the subway but due to the long weekend, the train service was infrequent and irregular. So be prepared for it if you are staying there during the weekend or public holidays. On the whole, the staff at this W does not behave as if they are club bouncers. they really make the efforts to ensure your stay is pleasant and enjoyable. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip, but has one design flaw in my opinion.”
Reviews.Author: seeingtheworld5
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. Very clean and hip looking. However, there is one design flaw that I did not like-- the shared wall between the bathroom and sleeping area is frosted glass. Although this can be very sexy if you are traveling with your spouse, it is not if you are traveling with a parent or a friend. You can see the outline of whoever is taking a shower! This really didn't bother me. It was the fact that the light, when turned on in the bathroom, shines into the sleeping area-not good at nighttime when you are trying to sleep! If you are traveling with someone who gets up at night to use the bathroom, this can be irritating. There was some noise from the construction until 9:30 at night, but after that did not hear anymore. If you want to take a nap during the day, the noise could be irritating, but at night it is quiet. In fact, I like how quiet it is here compared to midtown. Midtown is much, much more noisy, especially at night! Overall, I enjoyed my stay and thought the hotel was very nice. Food was very good and the bar area in the lobby was hip and comfortable too. Liked the complimentary coffee/tea in the morning and juice/water in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rissa0401
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the W hotel downtown - we got a really good deal on their website and we thought to give it a try. We brought our bicycles and even prior to coming they said they can accomodate either in storage or in our rooms (which we preferred). Upon arriving, the door ambassadors greeted us and helped us readily. They were very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to a larger suite (complimentary) because of our bicycles and signed us up for an SPG card. The ambience was very hip but we thought the staff was really friendly and down to earth and seemed to personalize everything! The room was spacious and the bed was comfy and the products were superb. There was only free wifi in the lobby or "living room" and there was a cost in your room $14.95 a day per device. We chose self pakring $35/day versus valey $55/day which was only a block down the street. Location was great, especially for us who biekd the city. Easy access to bike lanes, brooklyn bridge and the bike paths along the hudson river. We will be definetly coming back here again and try other W hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This W is a keeper because of the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Trav3lm0re
Reviews.Content: I love W Hotels, but honestly, they are hit or miss. The properties are always distinctive, but you never really know what your experience is going to be because of the people who work there. Sometime employees are really down to earth, other times they can be rude, surly and arrogant. I'm pleased to report the team at the W New York - Downtown made a recent one night stay a real pleasure. It started at the front door. I was warmly greeted, my bags were taken upstairs to the lobby, and a team of smiling employees met me to get me checked in. While I waited, a bellman brought me a glass of complimentary sparkling water from the bar. W takes care of details. This particular hotel is across the street from the Freedom Tower construction site at the location of the World Trade Center. The employee made sure to check me into a room on the side of the building opposite of the construction site where jackhammers start at 6 a.m. The bellman showed me to my room and explained that the hotel was an eco-friendly hotel. One interesting touch: to turn on the lights in the room, you insert your room key into a special device near the room's entrance. Remove the key and your lights go out on a timer. Keep the key in and the lights stay on. As I think about it, every single employee I encountered at this hotel was pleasant and helpful. The concierge helped me get show tickets and recommended a nearby restaurant. (It had opened 4 months earlier and was excellent.) Later in the evening, she recommended a special cocktail to try at the hotel bar. Before she left work for the evening, she stopped by the bar to be sure I liked it. (I did.) Speaking of the bar, the bartenders and cocktail waitress were real pros. It was like they were welcoming me into their home. Later, the next day at breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, I had terrific service from everyone I encountered -- the hostess, the waiter, the busboy. As I departed, the bellman thanked me for staying with them and asked me to come back soon as he loaded my bags into a taxi. I can't remember the last time a hotel staff -- to a person -- was so gracious and personable. Even a housekeeper greeting me in the hallway singing as I made my way to check out. The only bad thing I can say about my experience was the housekeeper neglected to remove a previous guest's dirty brown sock which was laying on the room's brown carpet. That's it. Oh, and I scored this room on Priceline for 160 bucks on a Sunday night. I would definitely stay here again. While the location is not walking distance to much of Midtown where tourists and business people want to be, the R Line has a stop at Rector St 2 blocks away next to Trinity Church.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: nina2727
Reviews.Content: My job required me to travel to NYC on several short trips and I stayed at the W for one of those trips. Big mistake. The construction noise is unbearable. The hotel is literally across the street for world trade center construction. When I asked to be moved to a room on the opposite side of the building I was told nothing was available, which I find hard to believe. I ended up getting less than 3 hours sleep as the construction does not stop overnight. The next day after complaining again about the noise, especially since my stay was for business, not pleasure and I needed sleep, I was moved to an itsy bitsy room behind the elevators....again noise! Also, the rooms are in dire need of refurbishing, the walls and carpets are dirty. There was a ball of hair in the bathroom, ewww... Would not stay here again, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay here for our Anniversary !”
Reviews.Author: LeeDempsey
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have stayed in many W Hotels and the service and decor is always excellent. I'm surpirsing him with a trip to NYC where we'll spend our Anniversary at the new downtown W which will be new for us. The reason I'm writing this review before is because I just got off the phone with reservations and the woman who helped me was so darn nice and helpful. She not only made recommendations to fit my budget but also wished us well on our Anniversary and told me how she was celebrating her 20th Anniversary this year with her Husband. This kind of personalized treatment is a what sets certain luxury brands ahead of some others. Thanks to her for getting my special day off to a great start before I even check in!

Reviews.Title: “What to say?”
Reviews.Author: ellysian
Reviews.Content: I stayed during hotel's soft opening so my comments are general as many services were bedding in. The hotel is downtown and with a bit of walking it's possible to get linked into subway system and go uptown. I think the immediate area around the hotel lacks any good restaurants and bars. Rooms were not up to usual standard for W Hotels and on the small side. The bathrooms were also small and I think poorly appointed and sterile. I continuall had to ask for shower gel as it was never replenished but I'll put this down to hotel training new staff. All in all an ok hotel but wouldn't stay here, even with substantial discount, unless I had business in the immediate area. I

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: snookie_d
Reviews.Content: Location: Close in distance to: SoHo, Chinatown, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, and South Street Seaport. The WWC is right across the street; although there is construction- we did not hear anything inside the hotel. The PATH train is about 1 block north of the hotel. I definitely recommend taking this from New Jersey. We also never had a problem finding a cab on the weekends. The hotel is a perfect location for business travel yet perfect for people there on leisure who don’t want to be near the madness of Time Square. Rooms: Rooms are on the smaller side (smaller than the Westin at Times Square) but very clean & modern. Enough room for two people who really aren’t spending much time hanging out in the room. To get power in your room (lights, etc) you have to insert your room key in the slot in the wall- hotel is going green. Hotel: Hotel is very secure. You take an elevator from the bottom floor to the lobby. To get to your room, you must use a different set to elevators and swipe your room key card. This I like because no one from the outside world could take the elevators for a ride. The lobby had a darker night club feel. We stayed on a Friday night, so there was a DJ and guests relaxing in the lobby at night. This was a nice perk! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. When leaving, they held our luggage so we could enjoy the city for the day at no additional charge. Our stay at the W Downtown was absolutely wonderful and we cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: annelbo1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W downtown for just a night and had an amazing time. The hotel is so beautiful!! The room was very comfortable and I slept so sound in the bed. They have a beautiful wrap around balcony behind check-in which I can imagine will be great in the warmer weather. The hotel is located next to ground zero. There is a little market shop right around the corner that sells everything you might possibly need if you can't find it at the hotel. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel for dinner and also lunch the next day. The staff was extremely helpful and even brought me my favorite coffee that they don't have in the restaurant, only room service! :)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: R70_11
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the W downtown was wonderful! Upon checking in we were told that we were receiving a free upgrade due to the fact that the room we had booked was not available. We were given a room 20 stories up overlooking the ground zero site which was very eye opening! The hotel was trendy and beautiful, the staff warm and friendly. It was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdngaltakestheworld
Reviews.Content: Ok so the hotel is a little far from the touristy times square but worthwhile. It's a brand new hotel, with amazing interior decor. Just an fyi - our room bathroom shower had the frosted glass wall which was an adjustment that we didn't expect. There was a few hiccups in the beginning with the bedding arrangements in the room but the front desk staff did eventually accommodate our group of four. There were also great recommendation from the helpful and brilliant Joy!! Ask for Joy.

Reviews.Title: “W style getting tired?”
Reviews.Author: yyzron
Reviews.Content: This week I finally got a rate at the W New York Downtown that was in my expense range. Looking forward to walking to the office, i egarly booked it, looking forward to visiting this new property. The layout is much like the W Times Square with a lift from street level to a Lobby on the 5th floor. The design of the lobby is quite cool. Dark, with a illuminated curved ceiling. This is probably the halmark of the property. Check in was courteous and attentive. I was a little dissappointed with the room. It seemed quite small, even for Manhattan standards. The TV was missing the AV input panel i've seen at a number of the other Sheraton properties. Too bad because I like to watch a movie from my laptop occassionally. For a new hotel, i think this is a oversite. In the bathroom again, i think there were gaps in quality, in favor of style. There were gaps in the trim, and some globs of caluking in some of the seams in the shower. Overall, like the location, would stay again if the rate is good, but with summer coming, might not be very often.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: HDHart
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful and extremely pleasant. On my first ,morning there, I realized I had left my cufflinks at home. One of the staff at the front desk went back into the offices and came back with a brand new pair of W cufflinks for me to wear. He truly saved the day! (I dropped them off at the front desk when I was checking out for some other forgetful soul!) The lobby setting was very, very cool and my room was excellent as well. A 10 if the scale would go that high!! Thank you and your staff for making my two days there so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall. Highly recomandable!”
Reviews.Author: alexvn2000
Reviews.Content: Impressive lcation overlooking Ground Zero. We got the other side for our room, very quiet. Rooms are small (like in most hotels in NY) but well arranged, modern and confortable. Hotel is modern, trendy and staff extremely helpful and fast. They did all our restaurant reservations giving us also advice and maps to get there easily. They have a free car service (you can use it once) but we did not book enough in advance but it is great to know. The Gym is really good ,clean. The only thing to improve is the room not 100% clean as we can expect for such a high standard hotel. Of course good but not spotless! Overall very recomandable and we would defib¡nitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, fantastic hotel - fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHolvoet
Reviews.Content: Superbe experience, very smooth check in , very nice room, got a corner room , very convenient. Breakfast experience great, a lot of food, high quality. Had one dinner, same experience, very high quality and extremely nice staff. Overall a very nice hotel. Absolutely advisable.

Reviews.Title: “Quite the Experience!”
Reviews.Author: gennybeans
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our long weekend in New York. All in all, staying at the W was an amazing experience. Despite not being a fan of the constant loud music playing, once we were in the comfort of our room, we were completely happy. The only downside to this stay was that we were travelling with my younger brother, and had specifically requested two double beds. Upon check-in, we were told there were no double rooms available, and we would have a roll away bed. Though, instead we had a mattress on the floor waiting for us in our room. Also, our bathroom door was not lockable. This wasn't a huge issue, as we're all family and could easily tell when someone was in there. Aside from these two issues, we had a fantastic 3 nights! It was super convenient, very clean, and the staff were very nice and helpful when asking for directions and restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: LC411
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the W Hotel for 3 nights. The hotel just opened in late 2010 and has yet to open all floors. Pros: - The hotel is right next to the World Trade Center so it's a great location if you're in NYC for business around the Wall Street area. However, if you're traveling for leisure, it can be quite a pain since it takes at least 15 minutes by subway to get to midtown. The subway is a quick 2-minute walk from the hotel. - The rooms are very spacious for a NYC hotel. The decor is consistent with the W brand and creates a very clean and modern look. I also love the Bliss Spa amenities. - We utilized the Acura car service as much as we could. It's a free service and can take you anywhere in Manhattan up to 90th street. You definitely need to book ahead though since it's a very popular service. I believe the hotel only has 2 cars available. - The employees were helpful and provided quick service. They were all friendly and very knowledgeable about the area. Cons: - The convenient location to Wall Street comes at a price. We arrived around 8:30 pm on a Thursday night and ended up switching rooms since we could easily hear construction of the World Trade Center. The front desk agent said the construction was supposed to end at 8 pm but it continued until about 9 pm. The noise must be very frustrating for business guests who are trying to work in their room. The front desk agent was very accommodating though in switching our rooms but I can see the noise causing a huge issue when the hotel is full with a limited number of rooms away from the construction. - The quality of construction seemed a bit spotty. Our bathroom door would always slide shut and the paint in certain areas of the hallway and lobby was already wearing thin. - If you're a leisure traveler looking for nightlife around the hotel on the weekends, I'd recommend a different location since the area will be dead. The hotel bar was also very empty on a Saturday night. - There is a kiosk in the lobby to check-in to your flight and print your boarding pass. I tried to use the kiosk twice and both times the system timed out. Though it's a great feature, the hotel needs to first make sure the system has no faults. - The TV channels were spotty with no reception on Saturday morning. This may have been a one-time issue since it only occurred then. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the W Hotel though it was a pain to be so far from midtown. I recommend the hotel for business guests and it'll be a great choice especially once construction of the World Trade Center is done!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms - downtown NY location. Dinner at BLT restaurant was excellent. Broken bathroom door that would not close and could not be fixed but we did not want to move (they did give us some Starwoods points) and terrible valet services. There was no one there and we waited about 45 minutes for our car.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant new place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: throopbournemouth
Reviews.Content: Opened in August 2010 this is a fabulous hotel. Overlooking ' Ground Zero 'its in a great position for either a business or a pleasure stay. The staff are fanastic and so helpful. The 'W' concept is one of high class, modern and 'hip', and so well designed. It has a great atmosphere.Right next to the underground so everywhere you wish to go is easily accessible - we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Petunia003
Reviews.Content: I called a few weeks ago and added on an additional night to my reservation. They couldn't adjust my original reservation, so made me a new one. This really should have been seamless to me as a guest, but for whatever reason was not. I went down to the gym, and my key stopped working so I could not get back to my room (elevator requires a key) then I had to wait in the lobby, they requested ID which I did not have since I just went to the gym. Then I had to wait for a security escort...just annoying. The car service they include is a nice perk, especially if you are a tourist and are headed uptown. I wasn't made aware of it ahead of time or would have reserved, it was booked up for the next day by the time we checked in. We ordered room service last night, hair in the salad. Bathroom is dirty and the lightbulb burnt out. Gym was not cleaned, half eaten banana on the treadmill...I was there for 90 minutes and it was there when I got there so I am not certain how often they check/clean gym. I'm usually not to high maintenance, but just found the service and rooms to be sub par. I have stayed at the W on Lexington and it was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: brklyngirl82
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. I stayed here before for valentines day and was so happy with the room and service that I decided to return. I spent the weekend here for my boyfriends birthday and he says that it was the best birthday that he's ever had. Everyone from Nataly in the whatever whenever to the concirge Joy were very helpful. The front desk person JJ was really cool. When I told him that we were here for my boyfriends birthday he upgraded us to a nice corner room where we coudl see eveyrthing and even gave us free drinks at there lounge. He even remembered our names from last time which was very impresive! Thank you so much to everyone for making our weeked so special. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Favorable”
Reviews.Author: Lorac
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel in New York's financial district sits directly across the street from the World Trade Center site. It is new and a touch gaudy for my taste. Our room, while small, was very comfortable and sound insulated (either that, or no one else was on our floor!). Bedding was deliciously comfortable, there were ample and large towels, toiletries, and an $8 bottle of $2 water. A couple of complaints: the bathroom sink (room 1811) was missing a stopper and there was no shelf in the bathroom. More importantly to me, Giovan, the receptionist, was aloof. I waited while he checked in a guest with whom he seemed friendly but his attitude toward me was not friendly. Additionally, I heard tell the preceding guest about a complimentary car arrangement that he failed to mention to me. I am not looking for friendship but do expect to receive good regard. All other hotel employees were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fine experience”
Reviews.Author: joseve
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. We enjoyed the quality of it, the friendly and helpful staff and we would advise it as a wel situated hotel for a visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service---only caution is taxi situation”
Reviews.Author: Folkgroupie
Reviews.Content: Service truly great--not the I'm cool young hipsters I've had at other W's--truly helped-car service good but you need to reserve that free Acura--- only problem is getting a taxi --because of location they are not going by and note since it's new several drivers didn't know it and I had to supply address. Staff works hard to get you one but it's tough

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, construction sucks”
Reviews.Author: seejuliego
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. The beds were incredibly soft and the room was clean. The bathroom could use more counter space or a place to put down your clothes, but overall was fine. My only complaints are the construction noise (jackhammering early, early, early in the morning) and the cost of the drinks in the lobby. Our most expensive drinks the entire trip were here! Also, one of the people we talked to at the front desk had no clue about any of the places we wanted to visit (like very popular museums and tourist stops), but did send our request on to another employee who was able to help us. The location was fine. It is super close to Battery Park to visit the Statue of Liberty and close to subway stops. We were never able to use the hotel's Acura service because it was always booked. But, we still had no problems getting around. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal/Thoughtful Staff”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem45
Reviews.Content: While we usually stay in Midtown, we decided to try a downtown location. I imagine this is primarily a business hotel but it treated the tourists well. Our room on the 29th floor overlooked the construction site of the 911 Memorial. Fascinating! This is a new hotel that has all the amenities you would expect of a good hotel but was complimented by a great staff all around. Room was very clean and ultramodern, complete with a peek-a-boo shower, Easy to get taxis despite the location. Perhaps not the best place for "New York" excitement there were still things to go. It is rather long taxi ride uptown but do-able. Room rates were very attractive due to the construction, etc. Would definitely recommend this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Still best place on Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: koenbl
Reviews.Content: After I stayed here before, expectations were high on our stay in the last week of March 2011. And again we were not dissapointed. I took some friends on their first trip to NY and the eastcoast. The staff at this hotel makes the difference - again. I stayed at several W's and the staff at the door, the bell desk and the concierge make this a wow-experience again. We felt at home and taken care of again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: sararara14
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this uber-hip new hotel. The decor is fabulous, the service was friendly and efficient, and our room was awesome. Clean and comfortable and the bed was great (not your typical hard-as-a-rock hotel mattress). Love the Bliss beauty products too! Overall, we had a great stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Utopia in the Financial District NYC”
Reviews.Author: mbmuscle
Reviews.Content: Stunningly beautiful design & bright colors, fantastic rooms. I called in advance & got a great rate for a 3 night business stay, I love the living room, with it's breathtaking decode & outdoor bar. Truly outstanding & professional service. I even met the General Manager who really cares what each guest thinks about their W experience. I highly recommend the Acura MDX shuttle for a free ride throughout Manhattan, far better than any car service or taxi. Great SUV & free :D

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLee31
Reviews.Content: The staff was super helpful - directions on how to use the subway, finding a neighborhood cobbler (Stanley's on Thames - excellent!), comping my cab ride when their complimentary car service was down for the day (what a great feature). Everyone there was so helpful - Sam was amazing & so friendly. I was also nervous about the location being so far downtown & it really wasn't a big deal at all - it's 2 subway stops from soho & 15min max to times square. Room & bath were clean - no bed bugs! I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “our stay in W-hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: bparthoe
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull experience in this hotel. We were upgraded to a spectacular room. I have visited NY before and have never stayed in a that spacious en luxuries room. As well the reception, as te carservice, as the GM (espacially the GM) made us feel welcome. We simply had to ask something en it was done for us. My daughter even cried when we checked out; That says enough. We will certainly come back tho this hotel. Greetings Bruno

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property”
Reviews.Author: Mfgib197
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad I took advantage of a weekend deal at this shimmering property. From the moment I drove up, service was fantastic. Young Sam at the front desk was supremely helpful in checking in this traveler, overloaded with bags -- as well as super friendly. I was more than a little pleasantly surprised that the property offered an Acura car service and that I was able to take advantage of it a mere 90 minutes later. The common areas, the bar with its interesting concoctions and plenteous eye candy, and my room on the 20th floor with view of WTC construction bore that sleek W brand I've experienced at other properties. Yes, there is construction noise; and, yes, catching a cab isn't as easy as you might think. But the friendly and remarkably proactive staff here and the wonderfully appointed property are worth a stay for anyone who loves NYC and anyone who loves the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASKNYC
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the new W Downtown with my mom and sister for a girls weekend. The weekend started on a high with the friendly staff at the door and at the Welcome Desk. The lobby and bar are fun and lively on Friday night with a cool crowd of New Yorkers and out-of-towners. We loved the room - hip and spotless yet understated and full of great treats - from the Bliss products to the fun mini-bar! And, of course, the comfy W beds. The restaurant downstairs, BLT provided a delicious late night snack & drink (try the chocolate hazelnut cake!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff and a Wonderful Valentine's Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: cameroons
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel downtown has a fantastic staff! The doormen went out of their way to take care of our bags, find a taxi (not always an easy task by ground zero), and advise us on the best way to get around. The concierge staff were extremely responsive, answering questions prior to my arrival and arranging dinner reservations on the spur of the moment. Not to be outdone, the cleaning staff were particularly friendly as well. Its a new building and the room was larger than I'm used to in NYC however some of the hallways were quite dark, its party of the trendy atmosphere perhaps but it made my significant other feel uncomfortable. BLT, the restaurant in the lobby was also fantastic... I ate the BLT burger and shared the Tuna. Great staff there as well! Overall, thanks for a wonderful stay - Cameron

Reviews.Title: “HORRENDOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: manvilleboy54
Reviews.Content: Between the tooth sucking, sighing complete with eyeball rolling front desk representative to the bellman repeatedly being sent to the wrong room to the fire department having to rescue trapped guests in the elevator and security knocking on our door to ask us if we had a wire hanger to help get them out to not having the correct rooms reserved having made the reservations six weeks prior and confirming every two weeks up 'til two days before check in- it's LAUGHABLE to think that ANYONE, anyone at all, has had any proper training of any sort at this hotel. There are plenty of wonderful hotels in this city even other "W" Hotels but this one is without a doubt NOT one of them. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - but needs to sort some teething issues”
Reviews.Author: UkSil
Reviews.Content: We always stay in and around the Financial District when we visit NYC, with the Millennium Hilton and Embassy Suits having been our regular hotels. We decided to have a change this trip and booked into the W. Overall it was a very good hotel, very modern and great location. As a Gold SPG member I got my complimentary upgrade to a larger room overlooking the WTC site. The Acura car service is very good - we made use of it to go to dinner one evening. My biggest complaint was the cleanliness of the room (especially over the weekend period). The carpet and bathroom floor didn't appear to have been cleaned when we arrived and the overall room servicing was patchy (often with toiletries not replenished etc). Overall a hit, but it has been open for 6 months or so, they need to bottom out these issues!

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyLancaster
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler who stays all over NYC. This is the best hotel in the city. Marvelous room, especially the bed. But the best was the customer service. Great value for a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: CarlosBernabe
Reviews.Content: It was a good experience staying at this hotel. The amazing decor is a top point. The room service is fast and great, also the restaurants. The happy hour is a good time to stay there between some wall street cuties. I just didn't like the room size (it was smaller than I expected) and also the early noise..they are building the WTC complex

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding quality all around”
Reviews.Author: esotericsilhouette
Reviews.Content: At W hotel in downtown new york, my family and i were overwhelmed with the over all quality of the hotel including the service, cleanliness, value, and appearance. We were more than satisfied with everything; specifically, their employees were outstanding with their friendliness, and helpfulness. The front desk employees such as Michelle Chang and Mark were very helpful and polite. Their porters Victor and Kareem were of great assistance when it came to helping out with luggage. Lastly, one of the drivers Ben was extremely friendly and a safe driver. All in all they provided us with quality service and a friendly environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: spgtraveler_11
Reviews.Content: W Hotel Downtown is in a great location. Lobby is absolutely beautiful. Check in was very quick, very friendly and courteous staff. Lobby bar and BLT restaurant are simply wonderful!! As a very frequent guest of Starwood properties, this W is a great choice over neighboring hotels. A+++ for rooms, staff, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “A Vibrant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EndtheFed
Reviews.Content: A very sharp hotel squeezed into the Financial District. The room looks directly down on Ground Zero. That ceiling in the lobby is simple wild. Staff is very friendly. You'll want to hang out in the lobby before heading out for the evening. Outstanding restaurant in the hotel, BLT

Reviews.Title: “OK but it is Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: johnc3720
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for almost a week on business as my company is located literally around the corner from this hotel. Rooms are ok but generally small, the beds are comfortable and showers excellent. There is an ipod speaker and a flatscreen tv in the rooms also. During the week this is an ok location with bars and restaurants but come weekend it is a ghost town. I also had issues getting cabs back to the hotel from other areas of New York city as they did not want to go back to Manhattan. Service is ok, building noise was not really evident and the car service was also ok. This is an ok hotel if the location is important to you, but I would say its probably over priced.

Reviews.Title: “This is not the place if you want dinning/theater/shopping in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: sjuhawk_jd
Reviews.Content: Just came back after a free night here using my SPG hotel points. The biggest problem with this hotel is its location. Their Acura drop-off service is a joke and no taxis will come to this area on weekend unless a hotel guest is arriving back to the hotel and taxi agrees to take you. The hotel is 1.5 blocks inside a main street with nothing but construction going on. The hotel is OK for weekday business crowd who are staying for business in downtown financial district. If you are arriving here for weekend (or weekday) stay for NYC attractions, look elsewhere unless you are getting a free night with your hotel points and all other starwood hotels in prime spots in NYC are not available. We had to wait 15 minutes for a taxi and I can see guests waiting for longer than 30 minutes during peak evening times to get one. It is about $18-19 each way from here to time square area by taxi. The contruction noise was not an issue for us as the contruction was not taking place on Sunday morning and it was raining, but I can see that as a problem also as noted by previous reviewers. The staff is friendly and extremely helpful, lobby is wonderful (but no action at all when we were there on a saturday evening during prime Christmas time), and rooms are nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patrik_10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel design, especially the lobby and bar are breathtaking! the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful! Sofia, the GM was amazing! Thanks Nicole for the restaurant reservations! Robert, it was great seeing you back! very clean and beautiful rooms with modern design! It felt as a home away from home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, sophisticated space in transitional zone. Worth a look.”
Reviews.Author: Vigi06
Reviews.Content: This location is worth a look if you want a place that's not bang in the middle of all that NYC has to offer on the weekend, but is close enough to get to it, or if you want a place from which you can easily get to a waterfront view for a quiet walk, this may be for you. The hotel sits next to the WTC construction site which is sobering, but that project is progressing quietly, and was not intrusive. W hotels have become favorites of mine and this one did not disappoint. From the lower deck entrance to the check-in experience in the visually impressive 5th floor lobby, to the clean, well-designed, quiet room, to the accommodating staff, to the lack of significant construction noise by the time I checked-out on Monday morning, to the very gracious general manager who came to meet me before I left to see how things were that weekend.....it was a good experience, and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you love pounding jack hammers and techno music this is a terrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelerpdx38
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly across from the WTC building site so the jack hammers work from 7:30am till dark every day except Sunday. The WTC project is about 4 years from completion. The hotel believes in loud techno music and uncomfortable seating everywhere in the hotel. The staff said this was a W "soft opening", we thought it a "hard opening". Rooms were tiny but the site across the street at least interesting! Beds were good and staff tried to be helpful but nothing quite worked from our heating unit to our friends' safe. Lots of money for a hotel that fell short of what it should be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: koenbl
Reviews.Content: I stay several weeks per year in New York. Discovering this new W-hotel last week was a pleasant surprise. The hotel is located close to 3 subway lines (1, R, 4+5 are within three blocks from the hotel), and very close to the ferry lines. The people at this W exceed expectations, both in efficiency and genuine friendliness. The staff in the hotel is among the best I have encountered in my recent stays in similar hotels. They are friendly in a very genuine way. They made me feel at home from the moment I arrived here. When I stayed here last week, some construction work at ground zero was taking place, but none of it affected the rest during the night. In day time, one can hear the noise of the workers, but not interfering with normal life. The room I stayed in is very spacious, has lots of light and is - in W style - very nicely decorated. The hotel itself has a very cozy atmosphere. The lobby on the 5th floor is designed to create this great W-atmosphere. The Sweat/workout has all equipment for a complete workout, and the BLT bar at the ground floor attracts not only hotel guests but locals from the nearby Battery Park as well. Great atmosphere: try the lobster ravioli! To be short: I will be happy to stay here again any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night Away!”
Reviews.Author: suzacoh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W New York Downtown this weekend with my husband. We wanted to get away for the night without the kids and had not been to this hotel in NYC yet. I had heard about it through some articles and was excited to have the opportunity to try it! When I checked in I was completely wowed by the decor of the hotel. The lobby design was really unique, especially the arched ceiling made of light. The front desk staff was very accomodating and they gave us a lot of information about the hotel services, including the restaurant BLT, which we tried for brunch and loved! Our room was very nice and it was great to stay at a hotel that was so new. We went out in lower manhattan for dinner and the doorman was very accomodating in helping us get a cab. There is still a lot of construction going on near ground zero, but it was very quiet in the room and during the weekend it was relatively quiet around the outside of the hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, especially if you want to be in downtown New York.

Reviews.Title: “Catch up trip to see our kids and Ground Zero progress”
Reviews.Author: hoffman_chas
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the amazing progress on the memorials and new buildings at Ground Zero, the new W in downtown Manhattan is the place. It's located right behind the Deutsche Bank building, which is nearly down, so the views into the heart of the construction will soon be amazing. The hotel is fun - good restaurant and bar and work out facility. We were able to arrange a free ride to the west Village for dinner from a joint promotion with the W and Acura. We normally stay in midtown when visiting, but the new W exposed us to new restaurants and sites we normally don't visit. A very enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: lisajahrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday weekend. The location is spectacular, with the downtown going through a renewal period. There is so much to see and do we never had to walk more than a few blocks for anything. The staff and management at the hotel were always available for any questions we had, Jason was especially kind, and we were very happy with everything at the hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but that is what you get when staying in NYC. The beds were very comfortable and the gym is amazingly well equipped (I was very impressed with the gym and the fact that they don't charge extra to use it). The other extra touches like coffee in the morning, water and pressed cider in the afternoons were really nice as well. I will absolutely be staying at this hotel again, and if they do put a park on the site of the old Deutche Bank Building the views of the WTC memorial and Freedom Tower are going to be unbeatable. We may have to bring our kids next time (or maybe not).

Reviews.Title: “New York is said to be the City that never sleeps. Unfortunately at W-Downtown sleeping is not an option.”
