Reviews.Author: paul21234
Reviews.Content: New York is said to be the City that never sleeps. Unfortunately at W-Downtown in our recent stay, sleeping was not an option. Construction noise was running at in excess of 80 decibels inside our guest room. On a number of nights construction noise ran until well after midnight, on the day we were checking out (which incidentally was a Saturday) construction noise began around 7.30am, which I guess was to be expected given that it had started at that time for the remainder of our stay. Half way through our stay I complained about the noise, the staff were courteous and apologetic and offered us another room. A room which would have been far too small, and did not appear to offer additional benefits with the exception of being on the side of the building and not facing Ground Zero. On the second last day of our stay, a voicemail came through at 10.04am (according to the message) to advise us that there would be no hot water in the hotel between 10am through to 4pm. I called Whatever Whenever (the Concierge Desk), to be advised that they did not know when hot water would be back on, and they would contact the company who had the gas off, hardly the pro-active response I would have expected from representatives of a Starwood hotel. Apart from the above, the hotel is new, has very nice and spacious rooms, with the exception of the side room that we were offered as an alternative, and has all the amenities you would expect in a W. I expect that the W Downtown will age fairly quickly given the white interiors, and I noticed in the room we were staying in, dirty black marks which had not been cleaned off, and some of the linen was already showing wear, particularly the towels. As you would appreciate I was extremely disappointed at the above inconveniences during our stay, particularly given that I had made it clear to the Starwood agent who had taken my booking that we would be on vacation, and we stayed in the hotel for 9 nights. My personal opinion is that Starwood either should not have opened this hotel, until the Dueche Bank building has been completely demolished (which the W’s staff told me would not be before at least the end of the year), or should be warning potential guests of the possible inconvenience, something they certainly did not do with me, although the manager on duty when I made further complaints on the day before we left told me he would ensure that happened in the future, something I will believe when I hear it with my own ears! All in all a very disappointing experience, and Starwood’s response has been to “gift me” points which I can redeem for a night’s accommodation. It hardly makes up for 9 very sleep disturbed nights, where we paid good money to stay in what should be a lovely hotel. I have stayed in Starwood hotels in at least seven different countries, all of our prior experiences have been positive in their hotels. I have never provided feedback such as this on a website previously. I provide this summary as a warning to potential guests of the W Downtown, so that they can make an informed decision before they commit to staying in this hotel. I should also add that I have passed on this feedback to the General Manager of the hotel in question some two weeks ago, she promised a response within three days, despite two follow up’s and two weeks passing no response has been received. Undoubtedly, indicative of what you can expect at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sven_baele1
Reviews.Content: I can only recommended this hotel to everyone because they are extremely professional and carefully, if you will visit New York there is one place to be and that is W hotel downtown Sven Baele Belgium

Reviews.Title: “The w hotel is blazing the standard where no one else is.”
Reviews.Author: puppeteer_22
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to the w in manhattan and we went to the oasis bar. They had excellent service. We were greeted by a bartender named marianne who added to the ambiance of the hotel with her wonderful charm.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, well arranged decor; speedy helpful service.”
Reviews.Author: etsou
Reviews.Content: I am always so amazed at how efficiently the W hotel rooms are decorated and arranged. I always take a moment and think "What is this like 250 sq. ft. at most? And they managed to fit a queen sized bed, flat screen TV, full sized desk, closet, decently sized bathroom, all while STILL having room left to extend a multipurpose area by the window (which we all know is the coolest part of any W hotel room)??" How do they do it?? Sigh* Only after five minutes of scanning the room do I manage to calm my brain down from the mysteries and wonders that can only come from superior interior design. Say THAT five times fast. Moving on: a half star docked because I just cannot understand why the shower (in its effort to look retro chic) has only a half-door. All the water splashes everywhere and leaves a mess. Eck. The staff at the W Hotel in Manhattan were extremely doting. I mentioned that I preferred a room above the 7th floor (less noise), so they assigned me to a quiet room on the 17th floor. In addition, after noticing that I placed a towel on the floor outside the (in my opinion, unfinished) shower area, housekeeping left a nice fluffy rug in its place when I returned. Thank ya much :) The concierge staff was supremely knowledgeable, and provided excellent directions and suggestions for the quickest and cheapest ways to get where we wanted to go. All I had to do was ask, for example, where I could find the best market for fruits within a walkable distance. And *poof* like magic, I would have three or four places to choose from within a matter of minutes. They sent me on my way with notes, directions, and a copy of that day's Wall Street Journal, and even a cup of lemon/lime infused water. It's the small touches. Overall, it was a very comfortable stay at one of Manhattan's most conveniently located hotels. Plus, W Hotels are home to Bliss Spas (which means, of course, they stock their wonderful mini goodies in room). Bliss girls everywhere, rejoice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff is the highlight of this new W”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: Only open just 7 weeks, we were surprised to see just how smoothly everything runs at the new W New York Downtown. We learned, over the course of our 5 night stay, that many of the staff have been with W hotels for many years. They must have chosen the cream of the crop for opening this new location. Every single person we met was friendly and solicitous and if they did not know what to do, they did not hesitate to find someone who did. We were made to feel as valued guests. Hip,sleek, shiny, modern and pretty...... as you would expect from a W. The rooms were a good size for NYC standards. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom and shower was great. Linens were top notch and the towels new and plush. Kind of everything you would expect from the words "W" and "new." Coffee in the am and apples and water in the lobby was a nice touch. Although you are waayyy downtown, 3 major subway lines are within a block or 2 walk. The hotel has a Acura service that will drive you anywhere in the city for free. Just be prepared for a marketing pitch on the Acura. Not a hard sell though and it was a nice feature. We ate at BLT for dinner and it was outstanding. Still quiet but the food and service was great. Breakfast was just "ehh." Our only complaint involved noise. Understandably, the dismantling of the building across the street is beyond their control. All of lower Manhattan in transforming and building. No one knows what might be built in it's place but the current construction will be short term. We also heard no noise from room to room....a pet peeve of ours. But..........It is a tall and narrow building and almost all rooms on the floors have close proximity to the 3 elevators. The elevators did not create a problem in our room but the doors to the hall do not block the sound of the guests standing waiting for them. No one seems to realize how loud their voices are and how they carry once they are out of their own rooms. As the hotel becomes more occupied, this might be more of an issue. I don't know how they can fix our biggest issue. Late into the night (2-6am), when all external noise has subsided and the air-conditioner is not running, the music from the lobby can be heard through the air ducts. Our first night, we thought the speakers for the outside terrace bar had been left on. The next night, we thought it was a nearby rooftop club? Then we thought it might be from the elevators..... but the sound was coming from further inside the room. It wasn't until 3 nights into it that we figured out what it could possibly be. The Front desk said they have never heard anyone complain about this issue before. Maybe it was our room location or proximity to the lobby (were were on floor 8 and the lobby is on 5) or just the fact that we were up at that time??? I haven't heard anyone else mention this issue and cannot make recommendations as to how future guests might avoid this problem. Other than that, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE W DOWNTOWN NY”
Reviews.Author: OnVayKay_10
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let let other TripAdvisor users know how much we enjoyed our three night stay at the W Sept. 23-26. From the moment our airport shuttle pulled up to the door, to our departure in that awesome Accura, our stay at this fine hotel was sublime. The staff members are so polite and accomodating! We loved our super-clean, modern room, especially the window seat with the view. The bed was perfect and the shower and Bliss toiletries were five star. The lounge/bar is so beautiful I couldn't believe it. The complimentary coffee and papers in the morning was much appreciated. After our stay at the W ran out, we headed over to another hotel to take advantage of some points we had saved. The service there was good, but the surroundings seemed very drab in comparison. I tell you, our "W" experience spoiled us for all others. We look forward to staying at the W Downtown again sometime in the future. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: MarnieMaroney
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The hotel staff was top-notch and very friendly and extremely accomodating. The hotel also offered a complimentary one-way car service by Acura that was a wonderful perk. The rooms were beautiful and the beds were extremely comfortable. I will most definitely stay at this location again in the future and would recommend it to anyone traveling to the NYC area!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed, but nothing they cant change.”
Reviews.Author: Socalac83
Reviews.Content: Checked in last week using Star points. The hotel was easy to find. Check in was easy and staff was great at check in. I will talk about all aspects of the hotel we used. Room- Kinda upset. Door was dirty. Scratches and dings all over the flat white walls. Spoke to GM and regrets using flat white paint. Room didn't have towels or hand soap on arrival. Great beds, great tv, cool phones, Apple docking system, descent size for NY. Seen smaller bathrooms. Rain shower was nice, but if your going to put a rain shower in the shower be sure to have multiple shower caps. Girlfriend needed to request. Elevators were cool, although you need to stop on the 5th floor then catch another to get to the ground floor. No way to go from your room to the ground floor. But as you exit at the 5th floor there was always someone to greet us, fresh water and apples were available. In Room Dining was not good. Presentation was cool. Ordered a cheese plate one night and it came with nothing. No breadsticks, crostinis, crackers, etc.. Just a few grapes? Never in my life have I had to pay for crackers or bread with a cheese plate. Location is 2-3 minutes from NYSE, Freedom Hall, Lehman, AIG, Trinity Church, etc. Will be one block from the new Freedom Tower when it's completed. View was not good from 801. Looking directly down at the construction cars and site, trash bins, etc... Reconstruction of the Freedom Tower is very important but the view from that side of the building is currently not to good. Will be great in 3 years when the building is completed. Living Room and Lounge were great and comforable. The Acura Experience was great, use it if you can. Way better then a cab. Staff were pretty good not great. Phone etiquette needs a little work. I know those paying between $400-$800 a night for a standard room don't way to be told to "hold on" or "wait a minute" wouldn't happen at the Ritz or Four Seaons. Would stay here again, but would definitely like to see a few changes implemented first. There are just to many options in NYC to be mediocre when people pay the rates they do in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wait about two years”
Reviews.Author: Ken_SF
Reviews.Content: I have a love hate relationship with W hotels. Yes, they are hip and sexy and make me feel even less of both. I will say my gripes are not with the staff, they are uniformly excellent, and the beds are the best. But the W Downtown has some serious issues. First of all it overlooks a construction site, the work at which begins promptly at 7 am with pile drivers and jackhammers. Its not any construction site either. Its the Freedom Tower site, AKA Ground Zero. I asked to be moved for my second night but they explained that none of the rooms on the south side of the building had been opened yet? Really? Who's brilliant decision was it to open the rooms facing a major construction site first? And here is the thing that really pisses me off--no outlets by the bed. This is a BRAND NEW hotel and all hip and wifi-ed and stuff. Has the W designer never traveled on business? We want to plug in our phones on the night stand and use our laptops in bed and you hide the outlets behind immovable furniture? Scores of business travelers wish a pox upon your house. (at least the desk outlets are above the desk). And really, why is wi fi free at Motel 6 but $15 a day here? I guess if you have business on Wall Street, it is a great resource. But otherwise, the location sucks. The neighborhood is desolate after 6. Quiet. But empty.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet rooms for great sleep. Cool restaurant and fun bar/lounge.”
Reviews.Author: Corin304
Reviews.Content: "It's brand new so the rooms are clean and the staff is eager to make sure everything works well and any problems get immediate attention. Sofia the manager and Bobby the bar manager really went out of their way to make sure me and my friends and co-workers were well taken care of. And Rachel the waitress was amazing, smart and friendly. Also Patty with the "Whatever" desk made sure my breakfast order was perfect and if it wasn't she check on me and fixed it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Service is a Stand Out; Location is a Negative; Decor is a Positive”
Reviews.Author: Surf_GypsyNY
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the staff at the W New York Downtown who made my birthday staycation a pleasure. My boyfriend and I booked the W New York Downtown for a 3-day birthday getaway. I was upgraded to a Spectacular Room by the GM Sofia and when I checked it, the staff recognized it was a special day and personally wished me a happy birthday. Lauren was my W Insider and she had left a birthday gift plus a signed birthday card from the staff! Inside my room was a tiny birthday cake and two cans of fizzy white wine. There was also a gorgeous tissue-stuffed bag containing a special texturized beach book, beach wipes and sunblock. Lauren knew from my boyfriend that we were going kayaking out in CT for a day. On the second day, I got another birthday card plus a rubber W luggage tag (very cute!) Note: Prior to my stay, Lauren contacted me and asked if I needed any help with reservations or suggestions. As a New Yorker, I didn't need any recos but took up her help in getting reservations to a notoriously difficult-to-get-reservations restaurant. Lauren and Joy (W Concierge) were able to score the reservations I wanted. Brilliant! ROOM The room itself was very comfortable. I'm not usually a fan of such modern design but it was very chic and warmer than I thought from the pics on the website. The bed was extremely comfortable (like all Starwood properties!) The shower is small but no smaller than most New York hotel rooms. The downside is the construction over the WTC. You'll get awesome views but construction starts at 7am Mon-Sat. We were on the 7th floor and across from the elevator. The walls are thin and so noise travels. We had an issue with the guest next door playing music (all rooms come with an ipod docking station) starting at 7am on a Sunday, the one day construction didn't occur. Luckily, we enjoyed his taste in music. The W also caters to a young crowd and our unfortunate location across from the elevator meant we heard noises until late into the night. LOCATION The location isn't ideal unless you live downtown and are looking for a stay-cation or are specifically coming to NYC to check out the WTC, the Statue of Liberty and other downtown sights. The subway is just a few blocks away so travel is convenient. Taxis are easy to pick up. Food and nightlife options aren't the best so far downtown but it's NY so it's still a good time. Walk about 10min and you'll be in Tribeca, a very hip part of NY filled with restaurants and bars. AMENITIES We tried the new BLT and it was amazing! Food is delicious and service is warm. We received a VIP card that among other things entitled us to 15% off all future visits. The Living Room Terrace at the W is gorgeous and drinks are well-made. Overall we enjoyed our visit immensely and would give this property 4.5 stars which the service really being a stand out.
